lifesaver cards, he/she should quit the game. However, each time the players can choose not to
answer the question by paying the same amount of dollar as they can get if the answer is right.
5. If the player lands on the Angel chevron, he/she will get two lifesaver cards; if lands on the Evil
chevron, he/she will lose one lifesaver card.
6. If a player is leading by 10 chevrons, then he/she could challenge the opponent with his own
question which is related to Bible. If the opponent wins the challenge, then he/she can move
forward 2 steps. He/she has to back up three steps if he/she loses.
7. The player reaches the destination first wins!

name: Pass the Class
description:
Object of the Game

The game goal is to pass all four grades and get to college first!

The Rules

1/ The object of the game is to get to "college" first with a
report card from each of the four English catagories from each
grade 9-12.

2/ Players can earn a report card by successfully answering a
question from that catagory after landing on the corresponding space.

3/ Players can move backwards or forward, but must move the total
amount of spaces rolled on the die.

4/ If a player gets a question correct, he or she may continue with
another roll or more until he or she gets an answer incorrect or
lands in detention.

5/ If sent to detention, a player looses a turn.

6/ After a player rolls out of detention, he or she can reenter anywhere in that grade level.

7/ A player may, at any time, forfeit a turn to go to summer school
in lieu of trying to pass a English catagory. In summer
school, the player has the freedom to choose the English catagory
that the question comes from.

8/A player may only go to summer school to make up for one subject for each grade.

9/In order to pass a grade, the player does not have to "land" on the finals space. Instead, the player can simply turn in 4 earned report cards to pass onto summer vacation and the next grade as he or she passes the finals space. In other words, a player cannot pass a grade level until he or she has earned three report cards.

10/ If a player lands on an office card, an office card is drawn and
directions are to be followed.

11/ If a player lands on a library card, a library card is drawn
and directions are to be followed.

12/ If a player get an answer incorrect, the player to the left may
at anytime "steal" the question and potentially earn that report card.

13/ A peek pass may turn a question into multiple choice at any time. Each player has two peek passes at the start of the game. After the peek pass is used, the player must hand in that pass.

14/ When a player answers a question correctly, he or she keeps that card as their report card.

name: Trivia Junior Russia
description: Lively and exciting game for kids who love quiz - now in pocket size! The game consists of 600 questions in six categories: Music, Sports & Games, Geography, Nature, Culture (TV shows, movies, literature), and Miscellaneous. Answer the questions and cross out 5 circles-categories with one side of the pyramid. If you are the first to correctly answer the last question, you - the are the winner!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ykpaїha
description: In Ukraine you have 400 cards with 2400 questions from six categories: History, Culture, Nature, Geography, Sport and Miscellaneous. Vast majority of questions concern Ukraine only. Collect a token from each category to begin your winning journey to the center square.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ukraine Trivia Travel
description: An interesting quiz game about the Ukraine - now in a handy travel size edition! The game includes 600 questions divided into six categories, which are History, Culture, Science, Geography, Sport and Miscellaneous
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Vraag het KUS
description: From the box! The best questions and answer game. With 300 questions about KUS (local girl band - translation KISS) and other issues that you like. Win by getting most cards! Number of cards needed is decided between players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die kleinen Lerndrachen: Mein Trainingsspiel 1. Schuljahr – Konzentration
description:
An educative game for children who have just started/starting primary school. Part of the "Kleinen Lerndrachen"-family of games from Kosmos.

The Learning Dragons, Lizzy and Lenny are at the flea market and see mirrors, clocks and much more. But the bus is leaving and the little dragons must hurry! Help them to gather the great stuff they need. The players race against the clock as they try to find the necessary items. Find the right ones and you get to keep it. The player who is first back on the bus is the winner!

A memory game for children.

name: Die kleinen Lerndrachen: Mein Trainingsspiel 1. Schuljahr – Lesen
description:
Part of the "Kleinen Lerndrachen" educative game series from Kosmos.

The players try to find the appropriate letters for words on the cards, the player with the most cards wins. The letters cards are laid out in groups of three, next to the stack of cards. From that stack you look at the first letter card - look at the three displayed word cards and see if there is a match. If they match you get both cards and may try it next card from the pile.

name: Pocket Size Bowling Card Game
description: Game of bowling from Warren Paper Products circa 1950's. Game features bowling pin shaped cards. From the box cover: For sports fans ages 8 and up. Make strikes, spares, fouls, splits, and turkeys.

name: L'Etape du Jaune
description: French cycling game published in the '90s about the Tour de France. What makes it very unusual is that the pawns used for player movement are large drinking glasses!

name: La Vuelta a España
description:
Spanish board game published in the '90s about the Tour of Spain.

Players move their pawns over the board with the use of a dice and travel through Spain starting traveling through regions like Castillia, Extremadura, Galicia, Asturias, Pais Vasco and Aragon to the finish in Madrid. He who reaches Madrid first wins the game.

name: Ciclocorsa
description: Italian boardgame published by a company from Milan in the 1950's. Comas with a board and 5 teams of metal cyclists (4 per team) painted in orange, yellow, red, green & white.

name: Jeu Circuit du Kochersberg
description: French cycling game published by a bicycle touring club from Strasbourg to celebrate their 20th anniversary. The board consists of six parts that have to be puzzled together; also included are 4 pawns (in red, green, blue & yellow) and two dice (in green & red).
publishers: Les Randonneurs de Strasbourg, Otto Maier Verlag

name: Le Tour de France - Jeu Officiel
description: French cycling game published during the 1950's in St.-Etienne on the Tour de France. The game can be played with up to three teams (in green, white & red). Each team consists of three riders. There is also is one yellow rider for the Tour leader. Although there is a map of France in the game this is not the gameboard. Instead there are three small boards.

name: Das new vnd kurtz weillige Eullen Spiegel
description:
You play with money and dice at a round gameboard, with an owl in the middle.

The literal translation of the High German name "Eulenspiegel" gives "owl mirror". However, the original Low German is believed to be ul'n Spegel, meaning "wipe the arse".

name: Das Affen-Spiel
description: A roll and move game, with two dice, published in Nuremberg. You will find some monkeys [Affen] on the gameboard. If the monkey looks forward, you can go forward. But if the monkey looks backward, you must go to the starting position.

name: Jeu de Cosaques
description: A roll and move game published in the Hague. In the corners of the gameboard one can see pictures from Moscow.

name: Picsoutour
description: French game about the Tour de France. Although movement is determined by a dice roll it does come with special rules for mountain & sprint sections.

name: Jagd-Spiel
description: A roll-and-move game published in Nuremberg. The gameboard depicts animals.

name: Neues Affen-Spiel
description: A roll and move game published in Nuremberg. If your counter hits a square with a special monkey (number 1, 7, 13 19 and 25), you must start from the beginning of the game and pay 3 Mark. The other monkeys pay 2 Mark.

name: Dass Glück- und Unglücks-Spihl
description: A game published in Augsburg (?). The gameboard is divided in a fortunate left side and an unfortunate right side. Both sides have 10 circles each and in these circles two dice are depicted. The throw of the two dice will decide the fortune of the player.

name: League of Nations
description:
In League of Nations, players are rival political parties struggling for power in post World War I Europe. By having the most political influence in a country, a player controls its government and may use its economic, diplomatic, and military resources to crush his enemies. But alas, rival factions wait in the shadows, ready to seize power. Push your citizens too far, and you might find yourself in front of a firing squad.

On each turn, a player may either 1) play an event card or 2) activate a country. Each player has a fixed set of event cards, allowing him to manipulate the geo-political landscape throughout the game in a myriad of ways. When a country is activated, the governing party can improve the economy, call for diplomatic sanctions, raise an army, engage in political maneuvering, seek international influence, and more. Rival parties have a chance to oppose every action, so unpopular actions may come with a heavy price.

After each country is activated once, the regions are scored. The game ends when every country has a representative in the League of Nations, a player reaches a certain number of victory points, or a party rules a certain number of countries.

This luckless game was inspired by eggertspiele's "not-quite-politically-correct game of tactics, agitation, and plenty of interaction," Global Powers.

name: Name That Union
description:
Given the names of 25 union crew members and 4 unions, the player will be able to categorize each crew member's name according to his or her union affiliation(s).

Each player must create a separate challenge sheet for every other player in the game. The player writes his or her name on each sheet as challenger, along with the name of the person being challenged.
Place a list of union members and their respective unions within easy reach, to be used as the answer key at the end of the game. Multiple copies (one per player) facilitate scoring.
Players must Challenge other players to be scored. The player with the most points wins.

name: Native American Rummy
description:
The learner will be able to categorize various aspects of Native American tribal life by matching such things as people and artifacts into collections which represent four major Indian culture groups: Plains Indians, Northwest Indians, Eastern Woodland Indians, and Southwest Indians.

The game has a structure that is similar to rummy.Players gain points by matching up sets of cards that belong to a particular suit. Each player is dealt 7 cards and the rest of the cards are placed face down (pick up pile) with the top card turned up (discard pile). The person left of the dealer takes a turn first by picking up a card from the pick up pile or the discard pile and laying down any "matches" that are allowed. The player must then discard and play goes to the next person. Play continues until one of the players has laid down all of his cards and then discarded. The winner is the player with the most points.

Components:
56 cards

name: Number Club: A Game of Place Value
description:
The players will use the positional property of our numeration system in order to build the largest (or smallest number as a variation) three-digit number.

Object of the Game it to Build the largest 3-digit number and win all the cards (A variation could be to build the smallest 3-digit number).

Components:
36 cards

name: Number Showdown
description:
Given a deck of cards with integer values from 1 to 100, with each number displayed on three cards as numbers written as numerals, numbers spelled-out, and groups of base-ten blocks, the players will be able to point out the greater of the numbers shown upon any two of the cards.

The rules of this game are similar to the card game "War".
Players turn their cards and compare the values shown on the cards. Whichever participant turned the card showing the greatest integer representation, then takes both of the cards and places them faced-up in a "win" pile next to his/her stack of faced-down cars. If the cards placed in the center of the playing surface are the same value, a showdown occurs.
Play continues until a specified time period has elapsed, or until one player has run out of cards.

Components:
300 cards

name: Number Thief
description:
The players will utilize problem solving strategies to formulate and adapt mathematical equations.

Gameplay is similar to rummy.
The play continues until one of the players runs out of cards. Scoring is determined by adding up all the cards that are forming equations. Each card is awarded it's face value and mathematical symbols are valued at 10. Any players with cards in their hand must subtract those cards from their total.

name: Nutrition Cards
description:
The players will be able to classify nutritional information given a food label with current information about various food products.

Game is played 2 different ways: as a "War" cardgame or as a rummy.

In first game players try to collect the most number of cards. The player who has all the cards at the end of the game wins.
In Second game each player attempts to make 'books' using the cards dealt. The 'books' consist of groups representing Food Group Boxes. The first player to complete all 6 'books' or Food Group Boxes wins.

name: O.B. Terms
description:
The player will be able to state the definition of major terms used in obstetrics.

Gameplay:

Each player receives seven cards dealt one at a time. The remaining cards are placed face down with one turned up.
The cards in hand are arranged in pairs by matching the word with the definition, each having the same number.
The word and the definition must be read before discarding cards.
Moving counterclockwise, each player discards pairs first and acquires one additional card in one of three ways: by asking another player for a specific card; drawing an unknown card from the deck; or drawing the top card from the discard pile. A discard card must be played unless the player is going out.
The player who goes out first wins the game.


Components:
100 cards

name: Objective Power
description:
The players shall be able to classify the given objective by matching the objective to its corresponding performance and content.

Players get Objective cards and try to matches those cards with Perfomance and Contents cards on the table.
Continue going through the Objective cards two at a time repeating as necessary until either no more matches are found or the solitaire is won by matching all objectives with their performance and content.

name: One
description:
The players will be able to put together numerous combinations of fractions that add up to "one". In the process they must be able to recognize the values of various fractions (i.e., that 1/2 is larger than 1/4), know fraction equivalents (i.e., 1/4+1/4=1/2 and that 2/4=1/2, etc.), and know the various combinations of fractions that add up to ONE.

The object of the game is to acquire the most points by collecting sets of fraction cards that add up to "one". The more cards used to add up to "one," the more the set is worth.
The sets are awarded points as follows: one card (such as 2/2) = 1 pt., two cards=5 pts., three cards=10 pts., four cards=15 pts., five or more cards=20 pts. Points for the sets are added up, and the player with the most points is declared the winner!

Components:
52 cards

name: Operation Rummy
description:
The playerswill be able to organize math sentences into groups and/or sequences by arithmetic operation and/or result of the operation.

Gameplay is like rummy. Player matches the answers of the math-operations from the cards to be scored for the sets.
The first player to accumulate 50 points is the winner.

Components:
52 cards

name: Clue Rummy
description:
Clue Rummy combines elements of a Rummy card game with the classic Clue board game.

Detectives play melds and layoffs while moving around the mansion, searching for clues or even hiding clues from other detectives. At the end of each hand, bonus points are scored for detectives who can correctly identify the correct suspect and murder weapon.

name: Big House
description: Vintage board game published in the 1950's in Belgium. The players are prisoners in the far west and their goal is to escape the Big House (the prison).

name: Die Hochtouristen
description: German board game from the 1900's where the player are mountain climbers. It has a roll & move system but what makes it unique is that it comes with a vertical standing board!

name: Strategic Rallye
description: Belgian vintage board game about a Rally with cars.

name: Ruck Da House
description:
Appearing in the pages of Britain-based G.M. Magazine (Issue 5 - Jan 1989), Ruck Da House is a game that features 2 players and a referee. One player takes the role of a family of Goblins and the other, a party of adventuring Raiders. The Raiders break into a house occupied by the Goblins in search of treasure... and mayhem quickly ensues.

The subtitle of the game is "A Light Hearted Game of Homicide for the Less Discerning Gamer," and most of the mechanics revolve around fighting and killing. The referee is needed to adjudicate the hidden movement which is most prominent in the early phases of the game. As the Raiders and Goblins search for each other, players plot their movement using a coordinate system laid out at the edges of the map.

The map comes as an insert in the magazine and the counters are to be cut out and mounted on a suitable material (such as cardstock).

If player are willing to share control of the two factions, then more than 3 players can play.
mechanics: Action Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Juego de Cyclismo
description: Spanish card game about cycling where you play out action cards to trigger events

name: Los Ciclistas
description: Spanish cycling game produced by a designer from Valladolid
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trikolos
description:
French abstract game. The board has 6x6 tiles on them. Each tile also has three round spots; on such a spot a pawn can be placed, some of these spots are yellow, white, green or orange. Each player uses four wooden pawns to play on the board (a white or a black set). The condition to move one of the pawns to another spot is that it has to be free and a green or orange color. During a game turn a player can either exchaneg a tile on the board, move his pawn to a green or orange spot or move a tile with an opponent's pawn on, in that case that pawn has to start again in the back row.

The objective to win is to reach the last row of the opponent's side with all four pawns.

name: Reflex
description: Very original Spanish board game with an airplane theme and a dexterity element. Each player has a set of jettons that they try to move to the discs on the seats of the corresponding arms. Meanwhile two airplanes are moving around above the arms. The player who first succeeds to transfer all his jettons to the correct seats is the winner of the game.

name: Catch a Thief
description: A crime has been committed in Catch a Thief. One player plays the thief; the other the detective. The thief moves his detective around lines across his board. The detective can not see the side of the board of the thief because this is hidden from him. The detective tries to deduct the movement of the pawn of the thief and eventually catch him to win the game.

name: Jeu des Vedettes
description: French board game published during the 1970's. In this game the players play an impresario who has to manage singer artists to the top of the billboard charts. Each player has to promote his star by using mediums such as radio, tv or by releasing a record or promoting them in the music scene. To do this the players can use promotion cards. The winner is the first player who can place 15 star discs on his palmares sheet. The game comes with images of real artists on the artist cards. These include the French singers from the 1960's-'70s era Johnny Halliday, Alain Barrière (who performed at the Eurovision song contest once), Thierry Le Luron, Michel Sardou & Marie Laforet.

name: Contrat 500
description: French game that combines some aspects of Gin Rummy (there are no cards in this game though) with Roulette. The goal is to finish 2 predetermined contracts as fast as possible. The players do this by choosing two numbers with their chits (that have also numbers on them). The moment that one of the players finishes his 2 contracts he wins the game.

name: Loto Tirelire
description:
French game published in the 1970's. It featured a set of 96 cards, tokens and a board with two rows with slots for 4 cards. The cards are divided in different theme sets (animals, celebrities, folklore, sports & work).

How the game works: each player receive a set of cards and each round they can either take a card from the player on their right or play a card in to one of the slots. If they can play a correct card on a slot space they may insert a token in a 'tirelire' (a little plastic box that represents a safe, every player has one). After every round the safe (which has numbers ranging from 10 to 1) moves one number down. The moment the safes are on number zero the game ends. The players open the safe and count the number of tokens in it; the player with the most tokens wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Le Jeu du Berger
description: French game that translated in English means 'The Game of the Shepherd'. Each player starts with a set of tokens and a set of colored balls with a value varying from one to three. There are also numbered charts that range from two to eight. Each turn the players choose one of their balls and allocate them in to one of the slots in the charts. Each round a player wins he receives 1 token from the other players. The moment a player runs out of token the game is over; he who has the most tokens then wins the game.

name: Echec et Mots
description: French abstract board game that mixes a word game (players have to form the longest word) with chess pieces (each player has 2 horse pawns that he can move on a checkers style board). The calculation of the points is done as follows: two points per letter of the word minus the number of letters which remains. A no-claim bonus is granted as well. The player with the most points wins.

name: La Course autour du Monde
description: French game from the 1970's. The players travel around the world (depicted on the board) with a civilian airplane. The players can choose to start either in Paris, New York or Tokyo but they have to through each continent to obtain five different visas. To do this the players receive a set of cards at random in the beginning of the game. Each card has connections between different cities on them. Each turn a card can be played to move a pawn to another city or a card can be exchanged for another one. The player who gets the five different visas first wins the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Un Nom pour un Autre
description: Each turn a card is drawn indicating a name or word to be chosen from (a celebrity, a city, a river,...). Then for each letter of this word the player chooses picks another card indicating a topic (sports, science, art,...). The first player to give an answer connected with the topic wins a point. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Le Dernier Mot
description: Based on a French tv show from the 1970's. The game consists of 82 tokens, each one marked with a letter and a wooden board with two rows with 10 squares (in each square a token fits). Each round a player forms two words (one on each row) ranging from 4 to 5 letters. Then the players take turns to modify the words (changing or to make it longer by adding and / or removing one or more tokens). The player that manages to make the word that can't be changed anymore wins that round. The player who scores the most points at the end of the game wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: La Course en Montagne
description: The board consists of a three dimensional mountain with 4 sides made out of cardboard. Each player receives a colored pawn in the form of a photo camera and a mountain climber in the same color. The players have to climb to the summit of the mountain, passing animals that live on the mountain and they have to halt at each spot where there is an animal to take a photograph of them in their natural habitat. When they reach the mountain top they have to descend on the other side, the player who reaches the ground first wins the game.

name: Memoldy
description: When a player lands with his pawn on a question square on the board he has one minute and thirty seconds to answer a question that either stimulates his short or his long term memory. If he doesn't succeed he has to return his pawn to the previous position. The game box mentions a minimum age of 60, this is a joke of course.

name: Secouris
description: French game subtitled 'caution is the mother of safety'. The board represents France with connections between all the major cities. Each player takes a pawn of his prefered color and places it on Paris. Each one then draws a destination card that he keeps secret. On each turn the player moves his pawn with the die and upon arriving in another city he has to answer a question that earns him a colored token; if he answers this correctly he may advance again, otherwise he passes. When a player has tokens of four different colors he has to race to his destination city. The player who reaches his destination first wins the game.

name: Roland Garros
description: French game themed on the famous Roland Garros tennis tournament. The game consists of a board where the players move their pawns and six 18 piece puzzles (that form a tennis racket), one puzzle for each player. When the player's pawn lands on a space with the same color they can take a puzzle piece from the stock. If they land on a different color they have to take a trivia card and if they answer the question correctly they may also take a puzzle piece. When they land with their pawn on an exchange space they have to exchange one of their puzzle pieces with an opponents piece. The player who finishes his puzzle first wins the game.

name: ManVrouw
description: The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: WTactics
description:
A strategy card game with little to no luck. Several unique factions and a total of more than 60 unique units with their own traits & stats. Only 30 – 60 cards needed for a complete army
No random card draws

Based off of the Computer game "Battle for Wesnoth" this is a fantasy tactile warfare card game. Line up your troops and fight each other to the death! The goal of this project is that every player has access to all cards available. You will never be stuck purchasing thousands of cards to find a single creature, instead you just print your army!

This game is licensed under the GPL
In short, you may play the game, spread it and even sell it if you want to, but whatever you do you must always do it according to the GPL license(s).
All card art used is under GPL2 or higher, and so is the shield & swords logo.
Any other graphical material which does not depict a character or the sword and shield logo and which relates to the project is naturally copylefted under GPL3 and is available in it’s original format(s) from this site.

name: Die Reise um die Welt
description:
A roll and move game. You travel from circle 1 to the goal at number 50. A lot of exotic animals and vehicles can be seen at the gameboard.

Published in Nuremberg.

name: Post und Reisespiel
description: A roll and move game. You travel from number 1 to number 37 at the gameboard, with pictures of cities and postmen from the early 20th century. Published in Nuremberg.

name: Eisenbahn-Spiel
description: A roll and move game published in Nuremberg, where you travel from number 1 to 36 at the gameboard. Trains, wagons and people from the early 20th century are depicted.

name: Jeu de La Laitière & du pot au lait
description: A roll and move game from Nuremberg, Germany, but the text on the gameboard is written in French. "Jeu de La Laitère" can be translated as "The game of the milkmaid". At the gameboard you learn about milk when you travel from circle number 1 to 50.

name: Wizzle Mozart
description: Each player has to complete a different puzzle consisting of 18 pieces. In total there are six puzzles depicting a scene of a Mozart opera (Don Giovanni, Requiem, the magical flute,...), each puzzle has a different color. In the beginning of the game all puzzle pieces are put in a bag. The players then take turns and move their pawn using a die. When a player lands his pawn on a space that corresponds to the color of his puzzle he may draw a puzzle piece from the bag, when he lands on a different space he may exchange a puzzle piece with an opponent. The player who finishes his puzzle first wins the game.

name: Le Jeu des François et des Espagnols pour la Paix
description:
Published* in Paris. A game about the war between France and Spain in the years 1635-1660. A gameboard with 26 oval fields.


A later edition published 1705, after the death of Du Val.

name: Neu erfundene Chronologische Spiel-Tafel zur Erlernung der Universal-Historia samt darzu gehörigen Reguln und deren Erklärungen
description: A boardgame where you travel from Adam and Eve to the year 1718.

name: Die wilden und die zahmen Tiere ein belehrendes und unterhaltendes naturhistorisches Würfelspiel
description: [The wild and the domesticated animals...]. A game with money and two dice, perhaps published in Nurenberg. If you move to a domesticated animal you get money, but if you move to a wild animal you must pay. If you hit the elephant with 6 + 6 on dice you win.

name: Das Stunden und halbe Stunden Uhr-Spiel zur einer Gesellschaftlichen Unterhaltung
description: Published in Nuremberg. A game with two dice and money. Different times of the day are depicted at the gameboard.

name: Die vier Jahreszeiten: Ein neues Gesellschaftliches Würfel- und Pfandspiel
description: Published in Nuremberg. A game played with dice and money. With rules in German and French.

name: Belagerungs-Spiel
description: A wargame with dice published in Frankfurt a. M. A gameboard with three concentrical circles around a fort.

name: Neues Frage und Antwort Spiel
description: A game with questions on 24 cards in German, English and French.

name: Die merkwürdigsten Männer des Jahres 1848
description: Published in Germany. A game with 28 cards, dice and rules.

name: Der Struwwelpeter: Unterhaltenes Gesellschafts-Spiel
description: Published in Neu-Ruppin. A boardgame with 9 figures. You have five possibilities to hit the figures with two dice.

name: Space Travel Hazards
description:
From Rules:

The Space Travel Hazards game was developed to help reinforce knowledge of space travel and some of the potential hazards associated with space travel.

The object is to get from Earth to Mars and back along one of two pathways to accomplish a successful mission. Along the way, teams acquire Radiation Points (RPs) that are detrimental to the mission. Teams will also acquire Mission Points (MPs) that measure the success of the mission. When the game is finished, plot the total Radiation Points and Mission Points on the Tally Card to see if the team had a successful mission and determine the game winner.

Components:
- copy of game procedures and rules
- copy of game board sheet
- Astronaut game pieces, 1 per team
- Chace Cards
- Tally Card
- One 6-sided die
- Pencil
- Score Chart (graph)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Le Jeu du Berger
description:
Le Jeu du Berger (which means The Game of the Shepherd) comes with two different variants the first one is possible from the age of three and is called 'Cours, petit mouton, cours!' (Run, little sheep, run!) and is 100% luck. Here the players have to throw a die and put the sheep on the free space with the same numbers as the die roll. The child who can place all his sheep the first wins.

The second version is called 'Petit mouton, rentre à la maison! (Little sheep come home!) and this one is possible for players aged four. Here all the sheep are placed on spots with a number ranging from one to six one. Now the children roll the die and they may remove a sheep every round but the sheep may only be removed if the number that the sheep is standing on is the same as the die roll. This way the game becomes a memory game. The child who obtains the most cheep wins.

name: Corse
description: Italian cycling game published in the 1960's. Up to five players each have a metal rider; one player acts as the bookie. Players then place wagers on the five riders who race to the finish line. The player with the most money after the agreed upon number of races is the winner.

name: Pic-Etape
description:
French two player game about the Tour de France. It consists of 48 tiles. 28 of them form the road, and must be played in order. The other 20 cards are landscape cards and are placed with one of their sides touching an already placed card.

The winner is the first to play the Paris card as long as he does not have any other card in his hand. Nevertheless, players take cards from the other player's hand once per turn, so the Paris card will change hands every once in a while.

name: Taste Taiwan: Princess
description:
"Taste Taiwan" is a series of thick postcard game relevant to culture and geography in Taiwan. The first game is "Taste Taiwan: Warrior". "Princess" is the second game of this series.

By adding "Warrior", it will become a four-players game. You need to match couples of different tribes during the game or you will get minus points. Each couple will give an additional score if you finish your mission on the map board.

Can be combined with:

Taste Taiwan: Warrior

name: Neu-erfundene Historisch-Chronologische Spiel-Tafel zur Erlernung der Teutschen Reichs-Historia nach der Regierungs-Folge der Römisch-Teutschen Kayser
description:
A game with 49 circles where one can see German Royals. In the middle of the gameboard one can see Charles VI (October 1685 – 20 October 1740), who was the penultimate Habsburg sovereign of the Habsburg Empire.

Second edition published 1726.

Third edition 1727.

name: Attack on Blade River Valley
description:
The battle by Union forces to retake the planet Bey was difficult at best, a slaughter at the worst, as the resistance encountered against the robotic Morpheans proved to be more difficult than expected. After months of fighting, the Unions 15th Combined Army commanded by Marshall Jean Baptiste, managed to break the Morphean siege lines among the hills and mountains of the sprawling Blade River valley.

The Blade River valley ran for hundreds of miles, and at dozens of locations throughout it, fierce battles took place for possession of key locations. Bridges, power-plants, military training bases, and transportation docks were its lifeblood and the focal point of the fighting. The 15th CA was reinforced by Union shock troops and mechs, enabling them to push the Morpheans back and eventually out of the valley area. Mustering it's reserve units, the Morpheans responded in force, not willing to concede defeat to the inferior humans. Wave upon wave of Morphean aero-fighters and bombers swept up the river valley in a final attempt to re-secure their dominance.

The Game

Bomber Run on Blade River is a 1-8 player game where the player or players take on the role of the skeletal Morphean robots with their aero-fighters and bombers, or the defending Union force with their missile equipped infantry squads, armored walkers, anti-aero guns and counter-fighters.

Attack on Blade River Valley is a free PnP consisting of a 9 page rulebook, 4 map pages (when all are combined), and a sheet of unit counters. In addition, the player will need about 6-8 d6.

The game was designed to be played at work station or table, depending on how many of the map pieces the player/s wish to use. When all the map pieces are placed together they cover an area the size of 4 sheets of 8.5x11 paper. The simplest form of the game uses just one sheet (To be added shortly).
categories: Dice, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling

name: World Affairs
description:
A game of strategy, money and people.

The object of the game is to secretly acquire the most money in your personal account so that when the game is ended you will be declared the winner. Personal money accounts are kept secret throughout the game. Each character assumes the parodic character of 80s infamy (such as Daniel Dictator, Colonel South and Ayatollah Iraney) to accomplish their indivual ends.

name: Tout à Droite
description: French board game about cycling. The game is a dice game, but an ambitious one, which simulates all the aspects of road cycling. As with most racing games; the player who reaches the finish line first wins.

name: Swing Set
description:
Get Ready to try new things.
Whether you are a woman interested in trying some girl-on-girl activities or a guy who'd like to be buried in up to his eyeballs in warm naked breasts, this game has something for you.

Play as couples or go solo
Share a hand with your partner and play the game as a couple or go it alone for maximum multiple partner possibilities.

Strategy wins the game
This game isn't just about the sex, it is also about screwing over your opponents and playing your hand smarter than the rest. Special cards can be used to double score, steal points and trade hands. Knowing how, when and with whom to fulfill sexual challenges is necessary to win the game. This game is like bridge or poker if bridge and poker were all about sex.

Directions:
The game may be played as two-person-teams or singles. Each player gets five cards. The first player chooses a card from their hand. Once the challenge is complete they score.

Any player may choose to give up their turn and draw five new cards.

The game is over when there are no more cards to draw or when one player is out of cards.

The winner is the one with the most points
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: 4 Spiele in der Box
description:
A compendium of four family games:


Primus Ludus. The aim of the game is to get one pawn of each colour (red, blue, yellow) to the center of the board. All players can move all pawns. The choice of pawn and direction is limited by two coloured dice. After rolling them, you have to move a pawn of one's colour along a line of the other's colour.
Sekundus Ludus. You roll dice to move along a path. Depending on the field you reach, you either gain or lose sticks. If you reach the finish with insufficient sticks, you have to do another round.
Tertius Ludus. An easy roll-and-move game, in which you have to get around the board with 3 of your 4 pawns. Similar to Pachisi, you may return other pawns to the start, too. The mechanic that makes the game special is the unlimited number of rolls you can make each turn. If you choose to roll another die, you can add the new score to your movement rate, but if you have bad luck, you lose everything and can't move this turn.
Quartus Ludus. A card game based on the Rock-Paper-Scissors mechanic. A joker beats rock, paper, and scissors. Every time you lose to another card, your pawn is advanced. The one who reaches the end fist, loses the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Palabras
description:
The instructional objective of the card game is for students to practice using Spanish vocabulary in comprehensible sentences.

The deck needs to be shuffled, then placed face down and separated. The first player turns over two cards. If one card is a vocabulary word that correctly fits into a sentence of the other card (for example sun and When it's hot, the _____ shines in the sky), the player gets to keep both cards and continue with his/her turn until he/she doesn't find a matching pair. If the cards do not match, the player must turn the cards face down again and the next player takes a turn. The rest of the players continue the game in the same manner.
The game is played until all the cards have been matched and there are no remaining cards. The winner is the person with the most cards at the end of the game.

Components:
32 cards
Sixteen of the cards will contain a single vocabulary word. The other 16 cards will contain a sentence with a blank.

name: The Great Plus-Minus War
description:
The players will practice simple addition and subtraction to collect as many cards as possible.

There are 2 face-up cards in the middle of the table.
The player turns over his top card and mentally adds or subtracts the amount with that on the start card. If the result does not match, the next player plays his top card, combining the amount with the previous running tally. The plays continue until a player matches the target or cards run out. In the first case, the player making the match is the winner. In the second case, no one is the winner.

Components:
40 cards

name: Predator!
description:
Players will have fun "hunting" while learning the food chains of several different regions.

The game has different variants to play. It can be played like War, or it can be played like Concentration

name: Prefix/Suffix Rummy
description:
The players shall be able to correctly build new words by adding a prefix and/or suffix to existing base words.

Each player in turn takes the top card from the draw pile OR from the discard pile, not both. If the player can form one or more words, the words are laid on the table in front of that player. Words must have a base word+prefix or suffix or both. (dis+respect) (respect+ful) (dis+respect+ful)
Scores are calculated at the end of the game. The total point values of the words in front of each player are added, along with any bonuses. Point values of the cards remaining in a player's hand are subtracted from the total. Each word which consists of a root word plus two more word parts i.e.: a prefix AND a suffix earns a 5-point bonus. The person with the highest point total wins

Components:
54 cards

name: Quadmania
description:
The players shall be able to make associations among properties that determine unique classes of quadrilaterals and identify those shapes.

The object is to acquire the most points by playing combinations of properties that determine unique categories of quadrilaterals.
The game is over when all cards have been played. Individuals that go out ahead of others simply lose their turn.

name: Racer Rabbit Rummy
description:
The learner will be able to group picture cards the include the letter "r" according to whether the "r" is in the initial, medial, or final position of the word and will be able to pronounce the names of the pictures correctly.

The learners are students who are receiving speech therapy services because of difficulty producing the "r" sound correctly. They are kindergarten through third grade students.

Players group the cards into sets of three or more. As each card is placed on the table, the name of the picture must be stated. If it is not stated correctly, the learner must pick up the cards and attempt again next turn.

The winner is the first player to lay down all his/her cards in groups of three or more.

Components:
43 cards

name: Relatively Speaking
description:
Participants will learn the names, faces, and quirks of a group of future in-laws.

The game is of the poker/rummy class and is patterned after the "go fish" type of card game.

Components:
100 cards

name: Renaissance Men
description:
The learners will be able to match artwork created during the Renaissance period with the artist and the period in which it was created: Proto-Renaissance, Early Renaissance or High Renaissance. In this domain the students will learn to distinquish the styles of the individual artists and the characteristics of the different Renaissance periods through a more social, entertaining method than the traditional method of slide memorization and reviews.

The game, similar to "Gin Rummy", is played in the following manner:

The object of the game is to form three sets from a dealt hand of nine cards.
The players chooses either the discarded card or a card from the face down pile. The player determines which cards to keep and discards the extra card. The first player to form three valid sets from ten cards wins the game.
The Use of "Mona Lisa" Cards. The deck contains three Mona Lisa cards which are wild cards. A player may substitue them for any card.

Components:
57 cards

name: Rescue Me!
description:
The learners will be able to properly sequence the procedural steps for a professional rescuer.
The learners will be able to answer specific questions about each procedural step.
The learners will be able to differentiate between infant, child and adult emergency care.

Each player is dealt 7 cards. The remaining cards are placed face down in front of the dealer to form a draw pile. The top card of the draw pile is turned over and placed in the center of the circle. This card marks the first link in the beginning of the RESCUE ME! chain.
Then the player places a card, called a link, next to the first card. This card must show either the next or previous step the rescuer takes to help his or her victim. Also player must answer the question on the card correctly.
Once a player has no cards left, the game is over.

Components:
116 cards

name: Resource Rummy
description:
The players will be able to recognize economic resources and the category type of each one.

The object of the game is to get two groups of three and four cards of 2 different resource categories. The player determines which cards to keep and discards the extra card. The first player to create two groups of three and four cards places the cards down and must name the two different categories (e.g., capital, labor) shown. The other players refer to a reference card that indicates all the items in their respective categories to verify whether the player is correct. If the player cannot name the two categories, the player on his/her left can name them correctly to win the round. The player with the winning hand gains one point. The game is over when a player reaches a predetermined score. If a time limit is set instead, the winner is the player with the highest score at the end of the time.

Components:
42 cards

name: Ritardando
description:
The players will be able to identify musical key signatures and their respective primary chords and will be able to define musical dynamics terms.

The game follows the format of the card game "UNO".
Player has to match the card in the Discard pile by placing down a card with the same key signature or a primary chord card of that key signature. Or, the player can throw down a Wild Card to change the key signature. First, however, the player must correctly define the musical term on the card. If the player cannot identify the term, they must draw a card from the Draw pile
When a player has no cards left, they win that game.

Components:
70 cards

name: Nutty Neckties
description:
From the Box:

In this silly game you try to get rid of your Neckties first by colour-matching the character shirts. Too bad you don't know what color ties you have.

name: Virtual Derby
description:
From the Box:

The Ultimate Interactive Theme Party Game! Introducing Thoroughbred and Standardbred Harness Horse Racing in the comfort of your own home. Virtual Derby includes a VHS videotape that contains over 20 actual horse races, an instruction book, a game board, horse markers, wagering pads, Derby Dollars, and official racing sheets. For experienced players, interactive wagering account and cable/satellite service (at additional cost) information and interactive code charts are included.

At the Beginner level, the game is played with the VHS tape of actual horse races. Review the official racing sheet and pre-race odds, select horses to wager on, view the race, and payout the winners in Derby Dollars.

At the Experienced level, the game is played with the game board, wagering pads, live televised horse races and the setting up of a real time wagering account through Virtual Derby's website.

name: Romantic Sensations
description:
From the Box: A game of Romance and the Senses. Romantic Sensations is a card game that combines and reinforces our senses of touch, taste, scent, sound, and sight to create a wonderful romantic experience.

To start, players read the list of prizes--romantic, sensuous activities to be enjoyed together. The cards are shuffled and dealt. Players then take turns picking a card from the deck, reading it aloud, and responding. Some cards ask for verbal responses, positive and supportive. Others suggest gentle touching, some playful, some subtle and ambiguous. When like cards are matched, they are placed down. The first player to match the required number of cards wins.

Note: the game box includes two small bottles of lotion ("sensuous massage lotion" and "bath gel") in addition to the question card deck.

name: The Team
description:
Theme
"Life as a warlord these days isn't easy, with warriors being increasingly picky about their teammates. Also, it seems like they just die too randomly anymore. Not to mention that opposing warlord across the chasm forming his or her own teams to combat yours. Only the shrewdest of warlords will emerge from this feud victorious."

Mechanics
The two players create small armies of fighters by playing card groups (melds). Then attacking player commits is fighters to the battle and so does the defender. Players alternate in attacking and defending until one of the two has captured 13 or more enemies.

Themed Rummy game created for the 2009 Contest.

Rules
Artscow Deck
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: CANNY Word Game
description:
It’s more than just a game, it’s a battle of wits where imaginations are fired and words are the weapons of choice.

In the basic game, the dealer shuffles the cards and then play begins with each player being dealt seven cards, one at a time, all face down. The remaining deck is placed aside. Players pick up the cards and hold them in their hands or place them face-up on the table. Using the alphabet letters on the cards, players create and writes down the word with the highest number of points. Alphabet letters can be used more than once. A player declares his/her words to the others, who then confirm each word and tally the points for that word.
In the advanced game, players may choose to discard cards from their hands and re-fill with new cards from the deck.
For example the word MUST: M = worth 7 points, U = worth 11 points, S = worth 10 points and finally T = worth 11 points tally = 39 points.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Print & Play, Travel, Word Game
publishers: Alphabet Runner Ltd., Superior Print On Demand (POD)

name: NéoEco
description:
Néoeco is a broader take on the corporate social responsibility theme: each player is the CEO of a business and has to make strategic decisions about water, waste disposal, human resources, ethics, corporate communications etc. Players compete with eachother on sustainability criteria.

Each player is an entrepreneur and has become more efficient in making the right choice strategic. It invests in it for renewable energy waste management, the fight against discrimination, etc.

For this, it invests in 6 areas: water, waste, energy production, communication and social.

55 cards very concrete and allow to change the game are earned or payable amounted to more than a player is ahead or behind compared to its competitors. The winner is the one at the end of the party, now the most prosperous.

www.neoeco.fr

name: Salute!
description:
The player will be able to classify the Officer ranks (O-1 to O-6) of Armed Services including Branch of Service, rank, device worn, and number/arrangement of stripes.

The objective is to get three of a kind, four of a kind, and/or a "straight" (consecutive string of Officer ranks) within any singular specific Armed Service. Each player takes his/her turn in reviewing their own hand, drawing one card from the draw deck, or selecting the first face-up card in the discard deck. Then, he/she discards one unwanted card, and the game proceeds to the next player.
If he has one of demanded combinations he shouts "Salute!" immediately. The remaining players are allowed one more turn to try to match, or exceed the hand of the player who commanded, "SALUTE!".
Every combinations score. The first player to total 500 points wins.

Components:
60 cards

name: See de tea
description:
Given a learning objective, the learner will be able to classify it in terms of the content/performance matrix.

The game is similar in several ways to Rummy.

To make a play, the player must hold a minimum of three cards that fit together in the matrix. These may be any combination of "kind," "level," or "objective" cards. For example, three "objective" cards of the same kind or type, two fact "objective" cards and a "FACT" card, or a remember fact "objective" card with a "REMEMBER" card and a "FACT" card. After three cards have been laid down, any related card can be added to the set. To begin another set, a minimum of three cards is required.
When the "draw" pile is used up, the round is over. Each player counts the number of "objective" cards they have played (do not count "kind" or "level" cards) and receives 1 point for each. Players with "objective" cards remaining in their hands must subtract 1 point for each.

Components:

16 "kind" cards (3 each: Fact, Concept, Procedure, Principle)
12 "level" cards (3 each: Remember, Use, Find)
33 "objective" cards

name: Sentence Challenge Game
description:
Theplayers shall be able to use the card game to practice/reinforce formulating complete sentences.

The players use the words on the cards that were dealt to him to construct a sentence. He is awarded the points assigned to each card used if it's agreed that this is complete sentence.
A game ends when: a) all of the cards have been dealt, or b)the score of any player reaches or comes closest to an agreed total (200 points suggested).

The person with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Components:
144 cards

name: Shape Search
description:
Given the deck of cards described below, the learners will be able to perceive and communicate descriptions of objects by observing the fine details of those objects.

The game is structured like the game "Go Fish". The object of the game is to be the first to get rid of all your cards by completing books. Each book is composed of four cards. A photograph of an object has been divided into quarters. Each card of a book contains one of these quarter photographs. When the four cards of a book are arranged on a table a photograph of the object is perceived.

Components:
60 cards

name: Shape Shuffle
description:
The player will be able to match plane figures and space figures by their figure illustration, word name, written description, and a photograph of an actual object with the related plane or space figure.

Each player in his turn either picks up the top card from the deck or the face upcard next to the deck. She or he then discards one card and places it face up on the discard pile so there are always ten cards in hand or tray.
Play continues until the first player who has Shape Shuffle goes out. To go out a player must have at least one 4 of a kind, either two more 3 of a kind, or another 4 of a kind and a 2 of a kind and scores for those.
Play continues until the first player reaches a score of 200 points.

Components:
56 cards

name: Shape Up
description:
The players shall be able to identify simple shapes embedded within complex figures.

The object of the game is to create "shape sets". A set is made by collecting all the shapes contained within one of the square cards. Each shape in a set is worth one point. The player who has used the most shapes (not sets) at the end of the game wins; that is, sets containing more shapes are worth more points.

Compoents:
66 cards
- 26 complex shape cards
- 40 simple shape cards

name: Shark Rummy
description:
The learners will be able to differentiate sharks by matching the different anatomical parts to form a complete shark.

Gameplay is similar to rummy.
To go out a player must have 4 of a kind twice. A kind is defined as the four body parts of a particular shark. Also player scores 100 points then.
Play continues until the first player reaches a score of 500 points.

Components:
52 cards

name: Skeleton Rummy
description:
Skeleton Rummy is a card game designed to serve as a learning and review tool for novice anatomy students. The game is intended to provide an elementary overview of the human skeletal anatomy.

The object of the game is to eliminate all of the cards in a players hand. This can be done by forming pairs (melding). The game is over when any player has laid down all of the cards in his/her hand. The player who eliminates all of the cards first, wins the game.

Components:
52 cards

name: Specahouse
description:
The beginning contractor student will learn to equate particular design structures with appropriate construction materials, while becoming acquainted with amenities that can appreciate the value of homes. Players will be able to build a house to spec on time by completing the house first.

Each player begins to assemble the necessary elements for construction and to collect attribute/obstacle cards to increase property values by retrieving 1 card from the pickup or discard pile. Players scores for completed houses.
The player with the most points wins.

Components:
109 cards
The deck is composed of 7 house element cards with 58 variations, 21 thematic design cards, and 30 attribute/obstacle cards.

name: Blood & Sand: Wargame Rules for the Mahdist Wars in the Soudan
description:
A campaign system and battle rules for miniatures, nominally for 10mm figures but applicable to others.

This set of rules forms part of the Real Time Wargames series, in this case covering the Sudanese colonial battles of the late 19th century where the British and Egyptian armies fought the warriors of the Mahdi.
publishers: Real Time Wargames, Realistic Modelling Services

name: Tableau chronologique de l'histoire universéle gravé en forme de jeu, avec l'exposition des règles de ce jeu et des faits historiques dont il est composé
description: A French game for children made for an educational purpose. At the gameboard one can se over 100 circles with information about important people in history.

name: Lexico UK-FR
description:
From the publisher:
A unique dictionary game – now you can have fun while learning French! Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words divided in five categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The three difficulty levels make it possible for each player to play on the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills. A game that all family can play together and learn languages at the same time!

name: Norge Quiz Junior resespill
description:
From the publisher:
The game includes a total of 600 Norway concerning questions! By responding to the questions you tick off the pyramid in your subject areas. You be the first to check off 5 circles, you are a winner!

name: Lexico NO-UK
description:
From the publisher:
Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language!

name: Camp Fire Girls Game
description: The object of this game is to try and enter the "Council Fire" while collecting as many 'Honor Beads' as possible while on the way around the board. The player capturing the most points in Honors wins the game. One unusual part of this game is that players all play at the same time. There are no turns in the game, so no waiting for your turn before you play. The winner is the player who captures the most Honors, not neccesarily the person who finishes the game first. You must get to the "Log Cabin Council Fire" by exact count in order to end the game.

name: County Fair
description: This is a card game. There are 3 classes of cards, cards called Sellers, cards with pictures on them called Spectators and money cards. The Seller cards and the Spectator cards are shuffled to form their own decks. The start player draws a Seller card to see what they have to sell and the selling price for the item and then a Spectator card to see if they draw a person willing to buy whats for sale. If they get that combination of an item and a willing seller the player takes the amount of money shown on the Sellers card out of the 'bank'. Some cards show 'no sale' There are also two 'pretty girl' cards, one will buy and one will sell. There is also a 'constable card' which if drawn, the player drawing the card is immediately arrested and so losses his/her turn. When the seller cards are exhausted the game ends and whoever has the most money wins.

name: Lexico LV-RU
description:
From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

name: State Capitals
description:
Players will be able to correctly match the 50 states in the USA with their capitals.

Object of play is to form matched pairs of states and their capitals. When a player gets rid of all of his or her cards, that player wins the game.

Scoring: The winning player receives 5 points for each card remaining in the other players' hands, whether they form matched pairs or not. Each player, including the winner, receives 10 points for each correctly matched pair and loses 10 points for each incorrectly matched pair that he or she laid down during the game. A list of states and their capitals should be provided to assist players during scoring.

Components:
100 cards
50 states & 50 capitals

name: States in Mind: Regional Rummy & State Line
description:
The players(s) shall be able to recognize the various regions within the United States and group states accordingly.

Player in his turn asks any one participant for a card from a particular region. If the participant has a card from that region, that card is given to player. If not, player draws a card from the stock pile. If card drawn from stock pile is of the region requested, player may continue to call on individual participants for a specific region until players or pile do not respond with region requested.
Play continues to left. When player has a complete region, that region is placed in a stack on the table.
Game is won by player with no cards remaining in hand.

Components:
50 cards

name: Street Drug Rummy
description:
Street Drug Rummy is intended to familiarize players with the common names and major classifications of illegal and abused drugs which are all too readily available on the streets today.

The object of the game is to group the cards with General Classification, Specific Drug Families, Way Administered or Sudden Death. Players can challenge another player on classifications, families, or sudden death combinations. The drug chart (last page) is used to judge the validity of the challenge.

Components:
54 cards

name: Strike-a-Chord
description:
The players will be able to organize keyboard musical-note representations into appropriate chord formations and state the name of the chord sequence correctly.

If the player has three or four cards forming a chord, the chord sequence is placed on the table. The player must then tell the other players the name of the chord. If correct, this player's turn continues by selecting another card as in step 2. If the player is incorrect, another player may "steal" the chord by stating the chord name correctly.
The winner is the player with the most chord formations.

Components:
46 cards

name: Striking a Balance
description:
Players will be able to analyze physical quantities into their fundamental units of measurement.

The object of Striking a Balance is to form balanced equations of physical units that appear in many physics formulas. Equations are formed with cards in various combinations, each card bearing a physical quantity which is broken down into its fundamental units. The winner of a round is the first person to "go out" as in Rummy, which means that the player can use all the cards in his/her hand to form complete equations. Points may be accumulated at the end of each round and the grand wazoo is the player who reaches 100 points first.

Components:
48 cards

name: Suave Poker
description:
The players will be able to identify the personal pronoun and verb tense of irregular Spanish verbs. This edition of the game includes only the present, imperfect, preterite, future and conditional tenses.

Gameplay is similar to poker. Combinations are with Spanish persons, tenses and verbs.

Components:
For twenty irregular verbs, there are a possible 500 cards.

name: Subtraction Sentences
description:
The players will be able to correctly complete subtraction sentences.

The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all of his/her cards. To do this, the players must use their cards to make subtraction sentences.
Player places in his turn either a number card, a minus card, an equals card, or a wild card with the face up card to create a subtraction sentence. A wild card can stand for any card the player wants.

Components:
75 cards

name: The Game of Hickory, Dickory, Dock
description:
Information from gamearchives.org:

Each player selects a piece and begins the game either on the "Start Here" space or the "Or Here" space. Players take turns spinning the indicator and moving up as many places as the indicator shows. Players play in turn trying to reach the UPPER SPACE first. A player must reach the UPPER SPACE by exact count in order to win. "When the clock strikes 1" that is to say, when a player spins a 1, instead of moving forward one space his piece is immediately dropped to one of the spaces marked "Start Here" and the players piece is obliged to climb again. The only time a 1 does not cause a piece to return to the start space is if the piece is 1 spot away from winning and a 1 would be required to win the game. Then the 1 spin does indeed win the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Monkey Shines
description: The game centers on a 3-D tree with a plastic trunk and cardboard leaves. Each player gets 3 monkeys in their color (there are 12 monkeys total plus one black chimpanzee figure). Players roll dice to have their monkeys climb the tree via holes in the trunk. If a double is thrown, the player must place the chimpanzee figure a number of holes. Any monkeys the chimpanzee passes must return to the bottom of the tree and start over. The first player to get three monkeys to the top of the tree wins.

name: Animal Hunt
description: Along the lines of Scrutineyes and / or Where's Waldo. Search and find different animals on a colorful game board.

name: Apollo Space Rocket Checkers
description: A checkers varient with a spinner determining possible moves. The game board also dictates special or extra possible moves.

name: Go! The Bahamas Game
description:
This is a roll and move race game where one player has 3 airplanes and the other one has 3 sailing ships... both players vie to get all 3 of their markers along the track to Nassau first. Extra turns may be earned and opponent markers may be blocked or sent back to the start.

So basically a nostalgic "tourist souvenir" game where you move pawns around a colorful illustrated game board with the instructions printed right on it.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fight that Fire Game
description:
Typical roll and move game on a very boring looking game board that is somewhat hard on the eyes.

Contents include: 32 Playing Cards, 4 Markers, 10 Fire Safety Tips Cards, 10 Chief's Orders & 1 Die.

name: Guys Next Door
description:
Game about the short lived Saturday morning TV series. There was a band called the Guys Next Door (1 album released) and the TV show centered around a series of sketch comedy skits featuring the band. Basically, it was a failed attempt at capitalizing on the New Kids on the Block mania.

The game is a typical teen girl fantasy game about boys.

Contents include: 20 Personal Color Photos, Set of Dream Girl Fantasy Cards, Dream Girl Spinner, 4 Pawns & Photo Gameboard with BONUS autographed photo of Guys on the back.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Seegover
description:
This is an attempt to make a game like Seega which is less subject to draws.

This game is played on an empty 5x5 square board. There are 24 double-sided pieces. The game is played in two phases. In the first players alternate placing two pieces at a time with their color showing; any squares may be occupied except the center. In the second phase players alternate moving one piece into the empty square.

A capture is made by sandwiching a single opposing piece between two of one's own. The captured piece is turned over. If at least one capture is made the moving piece may be moved back to the space it came from if that will result in additional captures.

There are two different versions of the game, depending on which rule one uses for the case where a player cannot move because they have no pieces adjacent to the empty space. In version one the player may take any of their pieces and place it in the empty space, but even if they capture they cannot then move it to its original space. In version two the player may turn over a piece adjacent to the empty square; in this case if captures are made the piece may be moved into the empty square if it can make further captures.

In either version the game ends when a player loses by having fewer than five pieces.

The game may also be played by three players using cubes with three colors on them; each player starts with eight of these.

name: Vector Powers
description:
This game was presented at 100 Strategic Games for Pen and Paper by Walter Joris. The game is played on a 4x4 board. Each player has 4 game piece in his/her own color.
At the begining of the game each player alternately, place eight friendly stones each.
During just four turns, each player shifts one row left/right, one column up/down or one of the two main diagonals, just by one cell.
Every stone pushed out the board is removed from play.
After those four turns (i.e., eight shifts), The player with more stones on board wins the game (or a draw if equal).

name: Chicken Roundabout
description:
Chicken Roundabout is a board game inspired by the 'Chicken Roundabout' in in Ditchingham, near Bungay (Suffolk, UK) a roundabout (traffic circle) famous for the chickens which can always be seen there.

The game is basically an enhanced version of Pachisi/Ludo, with the addition of 'tokens' required to get the chickens home. In this version, opponents' chickens can not be sent back to the start by overtaking them.

The game was previously marketed as 'Us Chickens'. The new version differs by having local businesses featured on the spaces on the board.

name: BrainBox: Manchester United Game
description:
From the publisher:
Manufacturer's Description
BrainBox Manchester United is a game for the whole family. The game is ingeniously simple. A player has ten seconds to study a card that shows players past and present in action and is then asked a question about the card, chosen by the roll of a die. If the card is answered correctly the card is kept, if not it is returned to the box. The most cards held after ten minutes decides the winner. Cards are real photos of players, with extra information like how many caps the player has, the year of their International debut and what shirt number they wear. Hard core fans can put their knowledge to the test--especially if their powers of observation let them down. The game is presented in a smart cube box and is a perfect gift for Man U fans who already have everything.

name: BrainBox: Kings & Queens Of England
description:
From the publisher:
The object of this game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes.

The first player takes a card from the BrainBox and turns the timer over. The payer then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player 2 and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player 2 checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to player 1 to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the BrainBox and the next player chooses a card. The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins. If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins.

For 1 or more players, and ages 8+.

Kings and Queens How many things can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try to memorise as many of the pictures and words appearing on the beautifully-illustrated cards. After ten seconds, turn the card over, roll the die and answer a quick-fire question to win the card. The player with the most cards after 10 minutes wins. A fun way to learn about our kings and queens of the realm. Age 8 and above.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: BrainBox: U.S. Presidents
description:
From the publisher:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the BrainBox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to player one to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the BrainBox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 or more players, ages 8+. Contains 54 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight sided die. Have fun!

Includes all 44 Presidents from Washigton to Lincoln, JFK to Obama. Can we do this...Yes we can!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Green Board Game Co., University Games

name: Flick Pool
description: Flick Pool is a dexterity game distributed in Whataburger kids meals. It consists of round tiles and triangular "pockets". Players take turns flicking the Cue Ball into other balls to try to get them in the pockets. It's just like pool, but smaller and flatter.

name: Race to Read
description:
As players roll the die, they make their way around a colorful racetrack. When they land on different colored spaces, players choose cards that ask them to figure out parts of speech, noun plurals, verb tenses, blends, homophones, definitions, idioms, context clues, anagrams and more. As players correctly answer questions, they power ahead on the track. Teachers can choose how many laps to complete to adapt to time constraints. Covers the following aspects of Bloom's Taxonomy: Knowledge, Comprehension, Application, Analysis

* Compact size saves space on the shelf and in the classroom
* High-interest graphics and content
* Short passages allow time for full comprehension and the chance to read a variety of topics
* Winning is based on knowledge and skills, not random factors
* Games address important content, not trivia
* Directions are easy to understand, so as not to restrict learning opportunities
* Players never lose points for wrong answers

name: Gauntlet
description:
Gauntlet - From the Klix Pocket Travel Games from Tiger Electronics.

The board folds out, the magnetic pieces (which function as both player pieces and tokens for the potion track) are stored in a built-in compartment and the dice are self-contained in a see-through compartment. The dice are 'rolled' by pushing and releasing the 'dice snapper'.

The board itself is broken into four sections: "Room 1", "Room 2", "Room 1-3 Treasure Room" and "Room 4". The players take turns moving through the rooms in order, landing on one of four kinds of space: a blank space, a space with food on it (which adds to the players food/HP), a space with a ghost on it (which subtracts from the same), and a space with a bomb (which advances the players 'potion track' by one). The final space on the Room 4 board contains the 'Sacred Orb'.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cheese Merchandiser
description:
Every player gets 20 cards in his/her color. Try to get a product together with four cards.
The objective of the game is to put the products on the board as favorable as possible. The player who puts his product on the middle of the board gets the most points.
The player throw two dice and put his/her two pawns on the grid of the board. Where the two pawns come together, a player can put a card of his/her product.
