If there is already a card, a player can change the card (only if he/she is the owner of the product). Or can try to get the space for his own product.(players throw dice to get the space)
When a player has placed all his/her products on the board, the counting begins. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Turn of Mind: A Game of Psychological Type
description:
The player will be able to identify the four elements of a psychological type and state the type represented by the phrases on the cards. The learner will be able to distinguish characteristics of the pairs of opposites represented by the phrases on each card.

The goal of the game is to form a hand comprised of one psychological type and three characteristics of one of the four areas of preference. The three characteristics must be the opposite of the one used to form the type.

Components:
52 cards

name: Vertebrate Classification
description:
The players will be able to correctly classify contemporary and extinct chordates according to physical characteristics.

Players try to create the classification hierarchy. Players must correctly identify which Genus belongs to which Order, and which Orders belong to which Class. This can be done from memory, or by reading the Genus characteristics on the cards and matching with them with correct Order characteristics.

As players obtain cards they will be able to place them in the play area if a higher card has already been placed in the play area. (for example a Genus card can only be placed in the play area if and only if it's Order card is available.)
The game is won when a complete hierarchy is built.

Components:
126 cards
- 21 Order cards
- 35 Class cards
- 70 Genus cards

name: Visual A "peel"
description:
The players will be able to choose the two dimensional shapes.

The object of the game is to collect the sides needed to create the surfaces of the shapes on the green cards. For example, if you were collecting the sides of a cube you would collect and group six square side cards. You can collect the sides of more than one shape at a time if you choose!
The game ends when a player plays all of her cards and wins or the time for the game runs out. If time runs out, add up the points on the cards in your hand. Subtract ten points for every stack of sides you successfully played in front of you during the game. The player with the LEAST number of points wins!

Components:
134 cards
- 8 green 3-d shape cards.
- 96 blue 2-d surface or side shape cards
- 30 flat red flexible building blocks

name: Wildflower Rummy
description:
To help learn Latin names, Genus/species, and descriptions of common wildflowers found in San Diego County.

Gameplay is similar to rummy.

Components:
50 cards

name: Womb to Tomb
description:
The players will be able to identify factors, traits, and lifestyles which contribute to life longevity or early death. They will be able to state whether the trait or lifestyle has a negative or positive effect on life span.

The object of the game is to get two different types of cards for each of the seven suits. When this occurs the player calls rummy. A player cannot call rummy if the cards are duplicates or make contridictory statements within the suit. For example "A nondrinker card and a heavy drinker card"

Each player starts arbitarily with 70 years. Score is computed once someone rummies. When rummy occurs, the person getting rummy receives 15 extra years of life. Each player totals their plus and minus years and adjusts their life span. Play may only be one round dealt(highest score wins), or can be accumulative over several hands. First one to 120 years(current actual record) is the winner, or when someone runs out of years the highest person wins.

Components:
108 cards

name: Women's History Game
description:
The player will be able to match famous women in American History with their historical importance (politics, labor, author, social work, or special interest).

Each of the other three players are given decks of equal fact cards. Players choose between blue, green or yellow. As the dealer lays down a face card, the players must lay down the appropriate fact card. Each player must lay down a card whether they are sure of their response or not.

After each player lays down a fact card, the dealer notes on a score sheet who won the round. There can be more than one winner for each turn and possibly there may be more than one winner for the game. The first person to lay down a fact card correctly wins that round and gains three points. At games end the total points are added up and the person with the largest score wins. To keep track of who was first, the first person to lay the correct card on top of the face card wins that round.

Components:
80 cards
- 40 face cards
- 40 fact cards

name: World Citizen
description:
The player will be able to identify the nationality of a person based on social interactions which include visual or written information about that person's country or culture.

Each player attempts to be the first to determine the nationality of the person described on the situation card and place a corresponding nationality card on the table. Each player must place a nationality card on the table OR forfeit one card to the discard pile. (Discarded cards remain out of play for the rest of the game). If two or more players place cards on the table simultaneously, then all cards for that play remain on the table and a second situation card is dealt over the first and players must attempt to match the second situation. Whomever wins the second play gets all of the cards on the table.

The GAME IS OVER when every situation card that can be correctly matched to a nationality card has been played. If a player runs out of nationality cards, she is out of the game until points are counted.

Components:
61 cards
- 25 Situation Cards
- 36 Nationality Cards

name: Zero Out
description:
The learner will be able to recognize and combine algebraic-like terms into sets of three. Each set will "zero out" (have a net value of zero).

Players sort their cards by types of terms. They position cards of like terms together. Players take turns drawing the top card from the remaining deck or selecting the top card in the discard pile. During each turn, a player must draw from either pile and discard one card before their turn is over. Each player tries to make two sets of three cards. Each set must contain cards of like terms that "zero out."

The player who successfully goes out, gets a score of zero. The other players will add the absolute values of the coefficients of the terms in their hands to determine their score. The player with the lowest total at the end of a set number of rounds, is the winner.

Components:
86 cards

name: Schweinefrass
description:
Schweinefrass is a card game, in which you have to remember, which cards were played before.
You play your food-cards face down on one of 7 pigs.
If a player pales a food-card on a pig, with the same kind of food already played on it, he has to return the card to his hand and must draw a new.
The fisrt player with no cards left in his hand is the winner.

name: Lexico Suomi-Venäjä
description: Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language! Win by getting rid of all your cards first!

name: Bungayopoly
description:
Bungayopoly: the Bungay Business Game is a roll-and-move business game inheriting elements from Monopoly. It is a local interest game set in the town of Bungay, Suffolk, UK. The board is composed of 4 sections, each featuring a photograph of local a landmark and spaces representing local businesses.

Unlike Monopoly, the properties are preassigned, with each player owning all the properties on their segment of the board. Players may spend money to develop these properties to attract rent from players who land on them. The properties all generate the same rents. The game is player with a single 6-sided die. A single deck of 'Take a Street' event cards is used.

name: Das Regenwaldspiel: ein WAS IST WAS – Wissensspiel
description:
The rainforest is in danger - and you are in charge to save him. The gameboard shows the forest divided in square spaces. Basically players roll dice, move, answer questions and place a "save"-tile on their spot in case of a correct answer. Otherwise a die-roll decides wether that space will be destroyed.
Some expedition cards and rule details add minor tactical possibilities to the game. The first player who has saved 21 spaces wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Quad
description:
Quad is played on an empty 8x8 square board.
There are 12 to 25 stones of each color off-board(the exact number should be decided by the players).
At each turn,each player must do one of the following things:
1.Drop a friendly stone into an empty cell.
2.Move a friendly stone to an orthogonally empty cell.
There are custodian captures(if the moving stone goes to a cell where an adjacent enemy stone is sided by it and another friendly stone,then the enemy stone is captured).
Wins the player that (a) makes an orthogonal 4 in-a-row,(b) stalemates the adversary or (c) captures all enemy stones.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Peter Rabbit: A Game
description: A Children's game from 1940. It is based on the Peter Rabbit stories and is a very simple 2 player game. The players spin a spinner and move accordingly with special events happening along the way.

name: Little Boy Blue
description:
A spinner based game from 1955 it has a bit more depth than the usual follow the path games.

Players guess where they think Little Boy Blue is hiding (which haystack) using their pegs to mark their guess. Then you use their second token to race to their haystack (by spinning in turn and using the big number on the outside of the spinner). The first player to reach the end of their path gets a reward token and spins the spinner to see where Little Boy Blue is hiding (the inner number on the spinner). Depending on the spin players take reward tokens or place them on haystacks to be won later. Rounds are played until all reward tokens are gone.

Winner is the person with the most tokens.

name: Lucky Fisherman Game
description: Lucky Fisherman features four colors player colors, each with a pawn and 11 matching bait pieces. Each player spins a spinner and moves on the board. The color of the landing space indicates if you get to move your bait closer to a fish, move back, lose bait, spin again, etc. Once you get your bait far enough it goes in the net and you catch a fish. There are 5 fish to catch at a time and 8 total for the game. Your bait is limited, so if you lose too many bait pieces you are done.

name: The Fisher Theatre Game
description:
A roll-and-move local interest game themed around the Fisher Theatre in Bungay (Suffolk, UK).

Players roll a die to move around a board. If they land on an action space, they draw a card and then spend 10 seconds acting out the role described on the card. The remaining players vote on the act using counters. Depending on how the act is received, the player earns or loses audience tokens.

The first player to receive 21 audience tokens wins.

name: Grand Casino
description:
From the publisher's website:

Grand Casino is a wonderful and exciting game for the whole family. It requires both skills and tactics, but a little bit of luck will also help.

The players are trying to form different patterns on the game board with their pyramids; your cards decide where you can place your pyramids. The player who forms the most patterns wins the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Memories of Madras
description:
Memories of Madras is a deck of 70 cards, each featuring a building in Madras. There are 7 suits of different colours with 10 cards in each, and a pair of Indian dice. Each card also has 1 or 2 keywords (e.g. Education). The rules suggest various games that can be played with the cards, such as Memory - collecting cards of the same suit; collecting sets of keywords; or trivia quizzes about Madras.

This game may be aimed more at the tourist / nostalgia market than at gamers.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Game System, Travel

name: Bomb Squad
description:
In Bomb Squad, players take on the rolls of technicians, disarming an explosive device. Just like the movies, there's a bunch of wires and you don't know which one to cut.

At the beginning of the game, one wire is removed from the deck and is the solution to the final puzzle. During a turn, players play Stress cards on each other trying their nerves and each round the player with the least amount of stress gets to see the remaining Wire's dealt that round and has an opportunity to guess. If no one guesses correctly after the third time through the deck, everyone loses as the bomb explodes.

name: Elastro
description:
Using an elastic band, each player tries to place his discs on the target (the closer to the center the better)
At the end of the game, a disc in the red central area is worth 10 points, 5 points in the blue one and 1 on the yellow circle.
A disc thrown out of the board is eliminated.

name: Ice Hockey
description: This Milton Bradley Game comes with 1 wooden disc and two wire hockey "crooks". You play the game by first placing the disc on the center spot on the boards and then each player takes a wire crook and then trying to draw or knock the wooden disc (puck) through the goal to the players right. The opponent plays at the same time, each player trying to get the puck into their goal. The game is started by one player tapping 3 times and then calling 'GO!" The game is played to a predetermined number of gaols. The player reaching that pre-determined number wins.

name: Champagne Adventure
description:
Champagne Adventure from 1989. An international board game of luxury and chance for 2 to 6 players. Object of the game: You can win Champagne Adventure in one of two ways. Either Acquire 10 million dollars in assets or Collect and purchase one of each color Destination card. The game comes with it's own champagne glasses.

From the game box: You have just purchased a London Townhouse at far below market value. The player to your left calls for an auction in Tokyo. Do you go or do you fly to Monte Carlo to make your fortune (or lose it) But wait, the player to your right is throwing a party in Rio. Etiquette requires all players to attend. What to do? what to do??

name: Shooting For The Moon
description: This game is a shooting game from the 1920's or 1930's. The game consists of a wooden standup frame with two steel wire hooks that clamp into slots on the top and hold the two sided tin target. On the front side of the hook the two dart guns can be hung. The game comes with 6 darts.

name: Q-Cards
description:
Q-Cards is an extremely Versatile set of cards designed to provide virtually infinite game possibilities. If you just want to play a game with a standard set of cards... here you go. Want to have access to multiple games designed specifically for Q-cards, here you go. Want to add a little twist to a current basic card game... here you go. Want to create your own game using Q-cards as a toolkit... here you go.

Q-cards are designed the be aesthetically pleasing, fully functional and extremely flexible without becoming overly complicated. Included are eight distinct suits which are built to work together in multiple ways.

Through a unique symbol association you can use it as a doubled up deck of cards with two cards per "suit". Also included are Icons on some cards to mnemonically remember what a card does in a given game.

Playing cards will never be the same.
categories: Card Game, Game System, Party Game

name: Kitzel Madokki
description:
The game consists of a "board", which is in fact a string with knots and ant pieces tied to it. At its end, there is a wooden cup under which a prize can be hidden. Also, there is a wooden anteater with a leather tongue plus several playing pieces in simple anteater shape.

The game rules are very simple: One player closes his/her eyes. One other player takes the anteater and tickles the blindfolded player with the anteater's tongue. If the tickled player guesses who tickled him/her, he/she gets to move forward three ants. If not, the tickling player moves forward one ant. The first player to reach the cup is the winner and gets the award.

name: Triune
description:
Game included in Pyramid Issue #7 by Steve Jackson Games

From the introduction:

Triune is a game of strategy and skill with the flavor of the classic board games of ancient Rome or Greece. Its name means "three with one," and its design combines the simplicity of checkers with the strategic depth of chess. Like both games, it can provide two opponents with unlimited games, unlimited variations ... and unlimited enjoyment.

Played on a chess board with pieces that resemble checkers, but have two different sets of abilities, depending what side is up. They may be flipped during the game.

name: Decapitation
description:
Subtitled "Hunt And Kill The Evil Dictator".

From the Background section of the rulebook:

"This is a fictional fantasy scenario where a very powerful nation wishes to 'decapitate a regime' (this is the technical term for political assassination). This is a highly detailed simulation and not 'battleships in Baghdad' at all. Most definitely not."

"The forces of good, Freedonia, led by President George W Hackenbush - being democratic cannot simply fire a nuclear weapon at the capital city of their enemy - they must use precision guided munitions and bombs to seek out the corrupt and evil Dictator they seek to ‘neutralise’.
These weapons are expensive so the bill will mount up.
They must also avoid civilian casualties."

"If the campaign to decapitate the regime fails to do so before a certain time has elapsed (see Ground War below), or the civilian deathtoll reaches 2,500 or the PR damage reaches 50 - Freedonia will have failed to achieve victory and the game ends."

"Play is on two gridded maps of the Capital City - Badmum. Some grid squares contain headquarter buildings, Presidential Palaces and the like - other contain Ancient monuments, hotels, embassies and residential districts."

name: Vauhdin Maailma
description:
From the publisher:
2400 questions and answers from all the Finnish motor sport like formula-1, Motocross racing circus, and boating etc.
Roll the dice, move and answer to the question needed and finish this trivia race first to win!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: En Avant En Masse!
description:
Subtitled "A One Brain Cell Diceless Divisional Level Napoleonic Battle System".

"Based on the En Avant! diceless battalion level game, this takes the concept to the next level."

"This system is designed to play out a corps battle using 6mm figures in about an hour or so. The intention is that there is a player per division, with a corps commander in overall control, per side."

"It is not intended that the players see or use the game rules - this is to be done by one or more umpires."

En Avant En Masse! is intended provide a rapid-play miniatures game that is accessible to non-wargamers yet still provides for successful results through the use of historical tactics. Gameplay is simplified by using labels next to each unit to show unit status and by having players use flashcards to issue orders.

name: Island Assault
description:
Island Assault: Toy Soldier Game About Hitting The Beach on a Pacific Atoll.

Introduction to the rules:

"This game is a simple simulation representing the problems of planning and executing an amphibious assault of Japanese-held island in the Pacific."

"The game is intended for use with 1/300 scale models."

"Ground scale is 1"=100 metres."

"Figure scale is 1 base = 1 platoon, one vehicle or gun model = 2 vehicles/guns. One landing craft = one landing craft."

Aspects covered in the brief rules include supplies (ammunition), jungle terrain, bunkers, artillery, and distinct landing craft for tanks and infantry.

name: Triablo
description:
Triablo is a strategy game of capture with special interlocking pieces, for two or three players.

Two players, White and Red, each have 10 pieces, called singletons, of their color which can move in any of the three directions they point to, any number of empty spaces. The singletons are triangular and can interlock with/capture enemy singletons at which point they form a doublet.

A doublet can move any number of empty spaces in any direction, but can only be moved by the owner of the covering piece.

A king is presented as 2 interlocking singletons of the same color and can move 1 space in any direction. Instead of moving, the king may abdicate his crown (covering piece) to another same-coloured singleton any number of empty spaces away in any direction.

An enemy piece is vulnerable to capture if three or more tips of the attacker's colour point towards it in unobstructed line of sight; one of these pieces must make the capture. Singletons can only capture enemy singletons, which they cover to form a doublet. Doublets and kings can capture any enemy piece by replacement to remove them from the board.

A player loses if their king is captured, cannot move or abdicate, or if there are less than three pieces under their control.

There is also a three player variation.

name: Little Lambent Meteors
description:
Subtitled: "18th Century Riot Rules. Being a description of the actions of sev'ral and disparate Stout Defenders of Liberty struggling against the Ungodly Forces of Insurrection."

This set of miniatures rules addresses conflicts between riotous civilian gangs and the police and military forces attempting to subdue them. The game is played between two groups of players and is moderated by an umpire. One group of players represents the forces of order, and the other group portrays the unruly civilians.

The game may be played with 6mm or 15mm figures. The game scale is 1 mm=1 yard and each turn equals 5-10 minutes.

name: Shot & Sail
description:
Shot & Sail: Small Ship Actions in the Age of Sail.

From the rulebook: "This is a game to illustrate the flavour of small scale naval naval engagements in the days of sail - most typically in the time of the Napoleonic Wars."

A miniatures wargame to be played on the tabletop with scale ship models. The players take on the roles of opposing sea captains. Statistics are given for a variety of U.S. and British ships, including schooners, brigantines, sloops, and gunboats. The simple rules encompass gun combat, boarding actions, and the effects of wind on movement.
categories: Age of Reason, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: De Familie Pluis
description:
Nijntje (Miffy) loves her family.She prefers to have everyone around for the cosiness. But everytime she has found almost everyone, silly Snuffie is messing things up.

Contence : 1 board, 25 cards, 1 Miffy figure, 1 die, rules.

Cards are placed face down in stacks around the board. Players take turns rolling the die and moving the Miffy figure accordingly. They then collect the top card of the stack next to Miffy. Drawing the Snuffie card allows the player to grab a card of another player. When a player draws a card they already have, the card is put back at the bottom of the stack.

The first player to collect the six different family members wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Science Versus Luck
description:
Science Versus Luck: A game of war, doctrine and matchsticks.

From the rulebook:

"The game is designed for a group of players -
ideally as a fun club project. It has scope for role playing, planning and playing with matchstick cannons and toy soldiers."

"To work best it needs around 10 people ideally in a club setting (ie. A hall and several tables), though it will work with less, down to two players and one table (if you just play the battle game part)."

"The players are divided into teams of 2. There are enough briefings for six teams, though it is easy to ad teams. Ideally you need an even number of teams, but that isn’t essential."

"The game is played in three distinct phases: 1. The Arms Exhibition - buying the weapons for the next war. 2. Evaluation and Doctrine - testing the new weapons and deciding how they will be used. 3. Battle - the acid test of both equipment and doctrine."

The Battle phase consists of each team matching a force of miniature infantry figures against another team's matchstick-firing model cannon. The cannons are acquired by the team's by way of an auction held during the Arms Exhibition phase. A team's model cannon must be operated in accordance with the doctrine drafted by the team during the Evaluation and Doctrine phase of the game.

name: Opportunity Troy
description:
Learn about the importance of free enterprise as you move around circa-1980 Troy, Michigan. As you do, you'll be buying and sell long-bankrupt local businesses while enjoying the sounds of long-defunct "Tower 92 FM: Detroit's Station."

Essentially a Monopoly rip off with a couple extra mechanics that were stolen, most likely, from Life.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Pusan Perimeter Pack
description:
Produced by the Kansas City Irregulars and distributed at the 2007 March Madness ASL Tournament. Not available commercially, 50 copies of this pack were handed out at the tournament, and is the 2nd scenario pack designed by the Kansas City Irregulars.

Contents:
6 scenarios
custom Bazooka counters

PuP1: Super Bazooka
Nonsan-Kongju Road Junction, 1/2 mile west of Taegu, 20 July '50

PuP2: Hey, That Ain't a ROK!
Near Hadong, South Korea, 27 July '50

PuP3: Bullets For Breakfast
Chindong-ni, 8KM west of Masan, 3 August '50

PuP4 The Grist Mill
Soesil, 2 miles Southeast of Ohang ferry crossing, 6 Aug. '50

PuP5: A Line Too Thinly Held
Kihang Ferry Crossing, Agok, South Korea, 31 Aug. '50

Pup6: The Road to Waegwan
Hill 121, 1 mile south of Waegwan, 19 Sep. '50

name: Pro Football Hall Of Fame Trivia Game
description:
This sports trivia game is designed for 2 players or 4 players... it also supports team play. Contestants move around the outer edge of the board answering football questions covering three historical periods: Early Years, Expansion, and Modern. After answering six questions correctly a player may enter the inner Hall Of Fame section of the board. A player wins the game by answering the Hall Of Fame question.

The plastic playing pieces represent an old-fashioned leather football helmet, an NFL football, a bronze trophy, and a replica of the Hall Of Fame.

The game includes a colorful board, 350 cards, 4 tokens, a single die, and the rules.

name: Wandering Words!
description: A game of placing triangle-shaped letter tiles to create and score words. To create a word, each of its tiles must touch the next letter of the word at a corner, but this path can be in any direction(s). Special tiles may also be played to boost your score, take extra turns, and reduce your opponents' scores.
publishers: Jeng and Associates, Wandering Words, Inc.

name: Young DSM
description:
A Monopoly like game. Try to buy DSM Business Units. When you got the whole set, you can buy plants. If another player lands on your DSM Business Units, you can collect money.
The last one standing when the others are broke, wins the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Almeida
description:
Game based on the small town of Vila de Almeida. Short listed in the Boulogne-Billancourt International Competition - Paris. The game rules and play draw their inspiration from the actual history and architecture of Vila de Almeida.

Almeida is a small town surrounded by two walls, making it very difficult to conquer. Not even an army is able to penetrate its defenses. The key to the town's defeat is the gunpowder magazine found in the castle. Six spies take advantage of the dark to enter the town undetected. Once inside they hope to conquer the castle. To do so they need to find a key hidden in the town. Will they be able to achieve their goal before sunrise? Will there be a double agent among them who will boycott the mission...?

The game is for 2 to 6 players, whose object is to enter the town's castle. To do so the player needs to find the key to the castle. For ages 8 and up. 30 minute game time.

Game box includes detailed information about the actual history which inspired the game. The rule book contains various illustrations to help learn the game and clarify all situations and rules.

name: Euro
description:
This game is a remake of "The Euro Game" shopping and sums by MAJORA.
For children from age 7 and up, the game teaches them how to deal with money and especially how to manage it. They’ll learn how to do a number of every day errands such as shopping, going to the bank, recycling, using a cash machine and crossing the street safely so they travel between the various places. The game is meant to be both educational and fun, so children can learn and grow, by doing things that usually belong to the domain of adults.

From the author: "Designing this game was a totally different challenge from inventing my other games. Actually, the game was meant to be a remake but when I started working on it, I made so many changes the game became a completely new one!
I tried to preserve the simplicity of the original game and keep the bills and coins the center of attention. New features were introduced, such as recycling and crossing the street safely. I hope this game is a source of fun and learning for all children and their parents. Have fun!"

name: Magne-trix
description:
A magnetic pendulum is suspended over a field of 8 blue and yellow magnets. Each player swings the pendulum 5 times. The game can be scored by adding the point value of the magnet over which the pendulum stops, or by betting which color magnet - yellow of blue - the pendulum will land on.

Instructions are in English, French, Danish, Finnish, German, and Swedish.

name: Hell on Wheels
description:
Hell on Wheels: Platoon Level Tank Tactics Game.

From the rulebook:

"The purpose of the game is to simulate the tactics and command and control problems facing individual tank troop/platoon commanders. Of necessity, such a game cannot expect to cover fully all aspects of tank combat at this level, and therefore I have chosen to gloss over the detail of the tank gun Vs armour battle, in favour of a more detailed communications and reactions system. Everything is very simple, but it is very difficult to do the simplest things."

"The game requires a minimum of two participants, Control and Player. The Control determines a fixed (or semi-fixed) defence for the player to fight through. Since such actions are likely to be fast and furious, there is often plenty of opportunity for Player and Control to swap roles. The Player is the commander of a single tank troop/platoon of whatever type the scenario dictates. These rules are written with the European campaign, 1944 in mind, but the structure can be applied to almost any tank engagement, with some small modifications."

"With more players, there is scope for larger games of up to squadron level, preferably with different units with their own terrain model. The back-to-back, two sided game
is also possible, but not recommended, since the detail necessary for correct interaction slows the game down considerably, and in my tests, the presence of a 'live' enemy made absolutely no difference to the players. It is recommended that when playing the higher level games, the ratio of 1:1 Player to Control is maintained if possible."

The game can be played with 1/300, 1/200, or 1/76 scale tanks. Each turn represents about 20-40 seconds. Each player represents one platoon/troop commander.

name: Le Jeu du Monde
description:
LE IEV DV MONDE dedié A Monsieur le Comte de Viuone, Premier Gentilhomme de la Chambre du Roy, par son treshumble tres obeissant Seruiteur Du Val, A Paris chez l'auteur P. Du Val d'Abbeville, Auec Priuillege du Roy 1645 Et se vendent Rue St. Jacques a l'Esperance.

The game contains two maps in the centre, one of the Old World, one of the New, the latter showing but naming the Southern Continent. The first square shows the Polar World, with small, individual maps of the 'Terres Arctiques' and the 'Terres Antarctiques'.

The publication of a new set of rules, a Nouvelle Explication de jeu du monde (Paris 1650) suggests that the game remained popular over a number of years.

name: Jeu de la Sphère ou de l'Universe, selon Tycho Brahe
description:
The game is concerned not only with terrestrial geography but with the structure of the cosmos. A map at the gameboard shows Europe, Asia, Africa, the eastern extremity of South America and the 'Terre Antarctique'.

A later edition published 1671.

name: Mappe-monde ou Carte Générale de toutte la Terre
description: A simple roll-and-move race game from Paris around the world and back to Paris, using a track of 80 squares, which impose various penalties and bonuses to those landing on them. Drawn under the observations of the French Royal Academy of Sciences, the centre of the gameboard is occupied by maps of the Eastern and Western Hemispheres. The 'Terre Antarctique' is described as an 'Unknown land situated in the southern part of the Globe comprised of New Guinea, New Zealand and New Holland'. A specific penalty is imposed on players so unfortunate to land on the Barbary Coast. They are to remain there for two turns 'because of the trade in Christian slaves which is carried on there', but they can be released by the arrival of another player on the same square.

name: La Géographie Universelle ou la Connoissance Exacte de la Mappemonde
description:
The globe, with the western and eastern hemispheres, are shown at the gameboard of this roll-and-move game printed in Paris.

Reprinted in 1780. By this date James Cook (1728-1779) had radically mofified the known face of he Pacific, but this is not reflected at the gameboard. Perhaps because of the cost involved in engraving a new plate.

name: Jeu Instructif des Peuples et Costumes des Quatre Parties du Monde et des Terres Australes
description:
[An educational game about peoples and clothes in the four parts of the world and Australia]

A roll-and-move game with 63 squares, where the journey begins in China and ends in the heart of Paris. Compositions allegorical of Europe, Africa and America fill the four outer corners, while the rules occupy the centre. The warmth of the Tahitian welcome is reflected, because all players who touch Tahiti must stay and miss two turns. New Zealand is described as the most terrible land to visit, because the penalty is to start again from square 1.

name: Jeu de Nations
description: Medallion maps of eleven European countries for an oval in the centre of the gameboard, while the outer corners are occupied by groups of figures from Asia, Africa, America and Oceania. The latter consists of tattooed figures very freely interpreted.

name: The New Bicycle Game
description: A simple racing game using a spinner for movement. The "new" in the title came from the idea of having each player start from a different point and follow a different route to the finish point. An exact spin is necessary to reach the end of the race at Centerville.

name: Ice Cream Scoops of Fun (2008 Version)
description:
This 2008 version of Mattel's Fisher-Price branded Ice Cream Scoops of Fun is similar in appearance to their discontinued 2000 version (see Ice Cream Scoops of Fun); but has sufficiently different rules, pieces, and mechanics to make this a different game.

The object is to be the first player to get four scoops of ice cream. Each player, in turn, uses the Ice Cream Scooper to randomly pick one of three ice cream flavors, yells out the flavor picked, and flips over one of the face-down Ice Cream Scoop Cards; if it's a match, the player adds the scoop to their bowl after screaming "Ice Cream!" otherwise the scoop is flipped back face-down.

Basically this is a preschooler-oriented memory-matching game where what you want to match is picked randomly and you get to do a lot of shouting.

name: Bob de Bouwer: Help Bob eruit!
description: Bob the Builder is so much focus on building a chimney, that he does not notice that he has himself immured here! The players must now put away brick by brick the chimney to help Bob out. The players take turns with their trowels to pull the bricks away. If Bob remains in the chimney, the turn is over. But if Bob jumps out of the chimney, the current player wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Stock ~ Split
description: Stock ~ Split is an economic game designed to teach players about the stock market. The game board has a slider to keep track of stock prices, allowing for variability between plays. Players move about the board by rolling dice, but different places offer different movement, depending on what was rolled (an even or odd for example.) Players buy and sell stock as the game progresses - there is no credit allowed in the game so if a player runs out of money then he or she is eliminated. The player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: NF's Gourmet
description:
"Two restaurants are fighting to earn the customer's trust for their food service, the quality of their dishes and the good recipes they are preparing.

5 customers, trying to choose on wich one will stay this night for their dinner.

2 shefs trying to stay calm , to remember where the raw materials are and to suggest a dish from their menu to each customer.

Finally the best restaurant wins the medal of the demanding gastronomic and prospective customer"

A card game for two players that combines sharp mind,strategy and alot of cooking!

3 Table Boards
5 Customers tiles
37 Cards
24 Medal parts
1 Illustrated rule book

Microbadge

Buy It

name: Evidence in Action
description:
The board game, which is similar to Snakes and Ladders, was developed as part of the World Health Organization evidence-based reproductive health care training package. It is an innovative and creative method, which enables participants to put into action the knowledge gained from a preceding training workshop. It can also be used as a stand-alone learning tool. The game was developed with a rural setting in mind, highlighting some of the logistical and health-related problems encountered in under-resourced countries
In the game the players need answer correctly the questions about Health Care.
The game is a roll and move and each position has a question about the theme.

www.mrc.ac.za/cochrane/boardgame.htm

name: Post Office-Opoly Holiday Stamp Edition
description:
From the Website:

The U.S. Postal Service is proud of its role in portraying
the American experience to a world audience through postage stamps. U.S. postage stamps magically transport us from sea to sea, from North to South, and everywhere in between!

POST OFFICE-OPOLY, The Holiday Stamps Edition, celebrates the magic of the Holiday Collection...

Since it’s inception in 1962, millions have enjoyed collecting, sending and receiving cards adorned with the holiday stamps.

Buy your favorite stamps, build monopolies, and increase your rent by adding Post Offices and Bulk Mail Centers...

Sounds easy enough, but throw in some "over the weight limit" packages, over-stuffed mailboxes and a temperamental dog and it gets a little more difficult and A LOT more fun!

Who knows?!? You may soon find yourself missing the seat of your pants... or you may be elected Postmaster General!

It’s YOUR roll!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Post Office-opoly Love Stamp Edition
description:
From the Late for the Sky website:

The U.S. Postal Service is proud of its role in portraying
the American experience to a world audience through postage stamps. U.S. postage stamps magically transport us from sea to sea, from North to South, and everywhere in between!

POST OFFICE-OPOLY, The Love Stamps Edition, celebrates the magic of the Love Collection... and who couldn’t use a little more LOVE!

Buy your favorite stamps, build monopolies, and increase your rent by adding Post Offices and Bulk Mail Centers...

Sounds easy enough, but throw in some "over the weight limit" packages, over-stuffed mailboxes and a temperamental bulldog and it gets a little more difficult and A LOT more fun!

Who knows?!? You may soon find yourself missing the seat of your pants...

or you may be elected Postmaster General!

It’s YOUR roll! Ya gotta LOVE it!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Post Office-opoly Wonders of America Stamp Edition
description:
From the Late for the Sky website:

The U.S. Postal Service is proud of its role in portraying the American experience to a world audience through postage stamps. U.S. postage stamps magically transport us from sea to sea, from North to South, and everywhere in between!

POST OFFICE-OPOLY, The Wonders of America Stamp Edition, celebrates the spectacular "Wonders of America: Land of Superlatives" Collection...

EXPLORE THE WONDERS COAST TO COAST!

Buy your favorite stamps, build monopolies, and increase your rent by adding Post Offices and Bulk Mail Centers... Sounds easy enough, but throw in some "over the weight limit" packages, over-stuffed mailboxes and a temperamental dog and it gets a little more difficult and A LOT more fun!

Who knows?!? You may soon find yourself missing the seat of your pants...or you may be elected Postmaster General!

It’s YOUR roll!

What A Wonderful Thing!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Monster Jam-opoly
description:
From the Late for the Sky website:

FIRE THAT BAD BOY UP!!!

Climb in and hold on tight for one heckuva game!

It’s all the fun of a traditional property
Trading game with some huge twists!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play...
Build your own Monster Jam® fleet of monster trucks.
Buy toolboxes to upgrade your monster trucks & trade them
in to build your dream garage & maximize your fleet’s value!

Watch out for roadblocks to your championship...
Flat tires, oil & methanol refills or a false start! It’s all fun & games until you’re sent to Digger’s Dungeon®& out for 3 turns!

You’ll find the biggest & baddest monster trucks here...
The monster truck titles have fun facts about your favorite drivers & the monster trucks! This game is loud & in your face fun...

So choose your token, fire up your engine & wait for
the green light! Who knows! You may be getting three 10’s
from the judges or you may be SHUT DOWN!

Whatever happens, this is one BIG ride!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Filosofia Cortesana
description:
Filosofia cortesana de Alonso de Barros
The game squares, numbering up to 63, lead to the ships sailing in the centre of the board on the 'sea of suffering'. The objective is survive and reach the new lands.

The players roll a dice and move your ships reading the information in the squares

name: Il novo bello et piacevole gioco della scimia
description:
Published by Altiero Gatti in 1588 featuring numerous monkeys displaying human characteristics.

Game of 63 numbered boxes, spiral, anticlockwise, centripetal that respects the classic rules of the Game of Goose. Geese are replaced by monkeys. Below right the name of the author and the date ("Alittento Gatti formis 1588").

name: Salvespelet Kalmar 1397
description:
This game was published for the life size reconstruction of Kalmar, town in south-eastern Sweden, as it was 1397 when the Nordic union was signded.
The players move their pawns around medieval Kalmar. On certain spaces they answer questions in four categories, all with connection to Kalmar and the middle ages. When all categories have been cleared a player may enter Kalmar castle and claim victory.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Terre-Air-Mer
description:
Early abstract wargame for two players or teams.
The board shows land and sea in a 16 by 20 rectangular grid. There are a few features on the map: a harbour, a fort, a town, a capital, an island and three trenches.
The forces are made up of 320 cardboard counters depicting land sea and air units. The units have different movement and fighting capabilities. They have also different point values.
The aim of the game is to capture the opponents capital. If the war is finished earlier by mutual agreement the winner is the one who has destroyed enemy units of a larger total value than the opponent.

name: TRILOGY
description:
From the box:

"What is TRILOGY like?

Three groups square off on a triangular battlefield. Your goal is to eliminate your opponents' warriors by strategically attacking them with your men. To accomplish this, you must engage the services of the neutral team (also called the Robot Team). Beware! Because your opponent gains control of the neutral robots on his turn. Both opponents move toward the center power source. Here they many choose to regenerate their forces or decide upon a strategic super attack. Look out! The unseen move can propel you or destroy you. Never give up... comebacks are always possible. Maybe you will be the next TRILOGY master."

Each player gets a team of six markers, and there is a third "team," that is the neutral robot. Each turn, players can move one of their pieces and one of the robot pieces. Pieces can move or jump other pieces. Jumping an opponents' piece or a robot piece eliminates that piece. Moving to the center dot on the board allows a player to generate another piece or take an extra turn. The first player to eliminate the opponent's team wins.

Published by "Ellis and Frazier Games"

name: Reveal 4
description:
From the box:

"The makers of Trilogy now bring you an exciting NEW card game of skill, luck, strategy, and memory.

Reveal 4 is a fast moving battle of memories in which individuals or teams match mind power to see who can be the first to "Reveal 4." Watch out! Just when you think you are about to win, your opponent can cunningly pull the rug out from under you. Rules are included for the basic game and advanced games."

Published by Ellis and Frazier Games

In Reveal 4, two teams of partners are dealt four cards each. First the cards are dealt face up, and then are turned over for no one to see. Players then take turns drawing from the "Trade" pile, which allows them to turn over cards and trade them with other players' cards, as well as mix up theirs or someone else's hand, or trade with the draw pile. When a player thinks (s)he has a complete set of four cards, the player announces it and turns their cards over. If the cards are four of a kind, the player gets a new hand. Otherwise, they lose their next turn. The first team to successfully reveal two complete sets wins.

name: Tänkolär
description: Tänkolär ("Think'n'learn") is a game of questions and answers about the bible, and three other areas of knowledge (each area has its own coloured cards). It contains 200 small cards, each with a question and its answer. The rules give thee different ways to play depending on the size of the group 2-4, 2-8 or 8-100. Most correct answers or, in one variant, most points wins the game.

name: Big Shot
description:
From the Publisher...

Run the pool table. Your child will have a ball playing with this Ideal Big Shot game.

•Step-by-step instructions and rubber bands teach your child how to set up and do trick shots.
•The ball is shot when your kiddo aims and releases the pool cue ball launcher.
•Your li'l one can bet against friends with play money to see who is the champ of the table.
•Details:
•Includes: 2 table pieces, ball launcher, over 30 trick shot cards, rubber bands, balls & play money
•15"H x 6"W x 26"D
•Ages 5 years & up
•For 1 or more players

Billiard styled game by Ideal. Setup the pool table to attempt billiards tricks. Game is played on a hexagon table with rubber band sides. Ball setup is done through trick cards and indentations on the table. The more difficult the trick the more money it is worth. A side betting game is also part of the overall game.

name: Seriespelet
description:
This is a Swedish football (soccer) themed card game for two players from the 1930's.
There are red attack cards and black defense cards. The first player plays an attack card. If the second player has a defense card he can save otherwise the first player scores a goal. The winner of the round (the scoring or saving player) has the next attack. The game ends when all the cards have been played and the winner is the one who has scored most goals.
A variant for four players is also given.

name: Brottarspelet
description:
This is a Swedish wrestling themed card game for two to four players from the 1930's.
The cards show different wrestling situations and the points awarded (plus or minus). The players in turn draw a card and places it face up on the table. This continues until each players has five cards. The winner is the player with most points.

name: Olympiaden
description:
This is a Swedish card game for two to six players from the 1930's themed around the 1936 Olympic games.
Each card shows an athlete, his nationality, which event he competed in and his result. There are five athletes from each nation (Sweden, Finland, Germany, England, Italy, USA, Japan and Canada. One card shows the Olympic rings and serves as a joker.
The players are dealt five cards each. On her turn the player draws a card from the stock and discards one. The player who first have all five cards of one nation wins the game.

name: Atlantflygningen
description:
This is a Swedish card game for two or more players from the 1930's about cross Atlantic flights.
There are four suits each showing an airplane of one nation (Sweden, USA, Germany and Italy) numbered 1-10. The Swedish 8, 9 and 10 show the cities London, Paris and Stockholm. There is also a Catastrophe card.
The The eldest player places chips in three pots representing the three cities and starts the game by playing any card in front of himself. The player who has the next consecutive card plays it and so on. A series can be broken by the Catastrophe card, the player of which starts a new series as does a player who reaches a 10. Whoever plays one of the city cards takes the corresponding chips unless the catastrophe card has been played in which case the player who first gets rid of all his cards receive one chip from each other player for every card remaining in his hand. The pots remain and added to for the next round.

name: Lyckonumret 13
description:
You need luck in this world! But knowledge is also necessary to get on in life - and it's the same with this game.
The board depicts a 68 space track from a river up a slope to the top of the mountain. Thirteen of the spaces are numbered 1-13 and have a subject written next to them, cities, rivers, songs i.a.
If a you land on a numbered space the next player in turn asks you a question on the given subject. If the answer is correct you may roll and move next turn otherwise you must go back one space. On certain spaces you have to answer questions from all other players. The winner is the first one to reach space 13.

name: Circuito Sideral
description:
[EN]
Game edited in Spain in the year 1958 and signed by Fagus (designer?).
It is a game for 4 players, though they can play more.
The winner is the first one in coming to the moon.
The components of the game are:
Two dice of 6 faces, one of them special, a board, four counters and instructions.
[SP]
Juego editado en España en el año 1958 y firmado por Fagus (diseñador?).
Es un juego para 4 jugadores, aunque pueden jugar más.
El ganador es el primero en llegar a la luna.
Los componentes del juego son:
Dos dados de 6 caras, uno de ellos especial, un tablero, cuatro fichas y un folleto de instrucciones.

name: Byen Rundt
description: It is, in all essentials based on the concept of Monopoly but apparently someone else must have owned the rights for the name. this is a copy of Monopoly make in Denmark in the 1930´s

name: Priests of Stonehenge
description:
Epic building in Ancient Britain.

Players control small clans near 2 mounds -- within one they shall construct a Burial Complex for their High King, and on top of the other Stonehenge shall rise and Druids shall gather there to bless the land. To accomplish this players need to feed their population and master the Wheel. Those that do so shall earn glory in this life and beyond.
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: Luppen
description:
Travel friendly trivia game from Finland in Swedish for any number of players. The questions are geographical.
The pocket sized box contains a couple of hundreds cards. Each card has one answer and four questions with decreasing difficulty and point value. Answering the question at the hardest level gives 4 points, at the easiest 1 point. A game goes to an beforehand decided total e.g. 20.

name: At the Cinema
description:
Get the best seating areas in the cinema by driving fellow moviegoers from their seats. If the cinema is full, the movie starts and the game is ended.

Every moviegoer is with a group of people who all prefer to sit on the best seating areas together. The cinema hall is divided into good, fair, and poor seating areas.

You need to ensure the best seating areas to be reached before the room is full, but note you also get points for the largest group sitting together.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Limn
description:
Limn is a balderdash style party game for four to ten players.

Each player gets a few pages from newspapers and/or magazines and clips words or phrases that could describe each one of the other players from these papers. When everyone has chosen phrases for all the players, the clippings are randomized and the players guess who clipped the phrases and who is being described. Players score points for correct guesses.

name: Game of Inventions
description: The purpose of the game is to educate players about the most up to date inventions (of the time) and their inventors. Up to 10 can play. Each player gets a card with 5 inventors listed on it. There is a pile of cards with inventions listed on them, and the goal of the game is to claim inventions that belong to the inventors shown on your card. The winner is the one who first completes his card correctly.

name: Five Little Monkeys Can't Catch Me Game
description:
From the manufacturer: Watch Out! It's not nice to tease a crocodile...players try to cross the creek and avoid the dangerous snap of the crocodile. The first player to make it all the way around wins the game!

For 2 - 4 players, ages 3 and up.

Contents: 1 game board, 8 monkey pieces, 1 snapping crocodile, 1 spinner card and instructions

name: Rugrats Party Whooper
description:
From Nickelodeon. "A matching game for young party-goers!"

"The object of the game is race to Finish Space and be the first to claim the party gift which awaits."

A Rugrats themed remake of Candy Land manufactured in the Philippines. 2-6 players move their tokens along the track according to the results of a spinner device. Players do not move space by space but from their current space to the next space as indicated by the spinner. The spinner has five possible segments; forward, backward, cake, balloon and gift. First player to reach the end of the track wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kaj & Andrea på Spilopper
description:
From the publisher:
Have a lots of fun with the naughty frog and the nice parrot - Kaj & Andrea. Game gives you many entertaining challenges! This game is made for the funniest disciplines. Can you example. stand on one leg and say, as a hen, or are you really good at flying? There are sure plenty of entertainment in this enjoyable game with both known and beloved characters from the television.
Children will try to do as their favorite TV character do on the cards! The first who get 10 of those card by doing right things needed, will win!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Let's learn the Calendar
description: The children are shown a card which has a date on it. The child who can find the correct day on his picture board wins the card. When the children learn to tell the date the game can be played so that you only show the children a card and they tell you what day it is.

name: City of The Dead
description:
It’s all gone to hell! You're a survivor, but there’s something you gotta do before you get out of town! Maybe it’s finding your husband, helping the guys from your precinct defend the hospital, getting your family to a safe zone or reporting for duty at the base.

On your own you're toast so maybe you'll hook up with some other survivors along the way, strength in numbers and all that. Maybe they'll help out, pull some strings with whoever is still out there to pull strings with. Don't forget the cops are out in force, hopefully they'll hold off the horde until the national guard get here or you could always give 'em a hand!

Can you make a last stand, unite the people of your town and hold back the tide of undead? Will you evacuate city blocks before they get infected? Can you get them to safezones or are you leading them into a trap? Will you lead the army or the police in counterattacks or try to figure out the cause of the threat with CDC? Will you help rally the townspeople and defeat the source of the zombies or leave ‘em to rot and get out of dodge with whatever and whoever you can find?

- Current Summary from the Designer
- This game is currently in development by the designer to be published through new imprint MODIPHIUS.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Nak
description:
From the Back of the Box:

The object of the game is to reach the score of 21. Each player gets to flick three NAK pieces. The first player reaching the score of 21 or more is the winner. A set of dice adds to the fun and excitement. To complete the challenge and skill of the game there are two additional holes in the board, a pink hole and a blue hole; the hopes and hazards of each player. For these holes there are two sets of cards, a pink set and a blue set. Each time a player's NAK piece falls into either of these holes the corresponding card is selected and the special instructions are followed.

name: Rock'n Reptiles
description:
From the Back of the Box:

Join your friends in a thrilling, exciting and fun race through Rock'n Reptiles. Simplified play for young children with easy to follow instructions.

User Summary:

Players take turns spinning a coloured spinner and moving their playing piece to the closest space with the colour shown (very much like Candyland). When a player first passes one of the eight marked locations, they take the corresponding location card. There is only one card for each location. The player with the most location cards by the end of the game is the winner.

name: Nashville in a Box
description:
Monopoly-type game depicting locations in Nashville, Tennessee.

1 x game board
6 x metal playing pieces
32 x skyline sections
12 x keys to the city
15 x big fun cards
15 x contingency cards
28 x Deed cards
1 x pack of money;
- $1, $5, $10, $20, $50, $100 and $500
2 x dice
1 x rules booklet

Buy property, build a skyline, trade for a key to the city. It sounds easy enough but add a traffic jam, property taxes, car fines and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult and a lot more fun.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Hofnar
description: A partygame where the challenge is building words letter by letter. Example: When the first player spins the spinner and gets the letter "B" he thinks of a word (board), so now he says out loud the second letter in that word "O", the next player now builds on from those two letters, but thinks of another word (Boulder) and says out loud the next letter in that word "U". Etc. Play continues until a player cannot add a letter or only has the option to add the final letter to make a complete word.

name: Additions: Soustractions
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The game contains:

* A 40 pages rule book with the rules for 12 games, including game samples
* 32 playing cards
* All that in a metal box

12 games to teach progressively substraction and addition.

Using well known game designs: Rummy, Old Maid, War and variants using the "Mistigri" card and the "Cameleon" card.
Whoever owns The "Mistigri" loses the game.
WIle the "Cameleon" card acts as a wild card.

name: Plunk A Skunk
description:
"Looking to get out a little pent-up aggression but don't feel like destroying your flatware? Plunk-A-Skunk is for you. Fans of the Whack-A-Mole carnival game found on Jersey Shore boardwalks will be familiar with this game's manic bonking action. As each of the skunk heads on the playing field light up you have to ding them with the padded Plunk-A-Skunk mallet to score points. Bang away and skunks taunt and praise you with phrases like "Time is running out" and "You're awesome."

Electronic game, home variant of the popular arcade/funfair game where small creatures (usually crocodiles or gophers) pop in and out of holes in the board, and the players score points by hitting ("plunking") them with inflatable mallets. This variant uses skunk faces that randomly light up; the player scores points by hitting a skunk face when it is illuminated.

Mildly amusing fun, with limited replay value, and fresh batteries are a must.

name: Planeten Spiel
description:
The gameboard is divided in seven fields, from the top to the bottom: 3, 1 & 3. At the top one can see the planets: Saturn, Jupiter and Mars. In the middle: the Sun. At the bottom: Venus, the moon of the Earth and Mercury.

Published in Augsburg, Germany.

name: Der Siebener
description: A gameboard with eleven panels, five to the left and right and one in the middle. Each panel has a joker and a number. The drinking joker in the middle is number 7. To the left one can see the numbers 2-6 and to the right 8-12.

name: Diamonds & Pivots
description:
Diamonds & Pivots is a 2 player game played on an 5x5 hexagonal board.
Each player passes or drops a friendly stone over an empty cell.
If any diamond patterns with four friendly stones are made,the player must choose one,choose a stone from it(the pivot),and place its other three stones in a line starting from the pivot.
After two passes,wins the player with more stones.

name: Sunshine
description:
It is a very simple and delightful game for children age 4-7 years.
For 2 or 4 children.
All compete in removing the clouds from their section of the board and let the sunshine in.
The first player to do this is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Das Spiel der Liebenden und Verliebten
description: The gameboard is divided in 20 squares with depictions of 19 men, and one woman, in love. Some of the squares have depictions of dice.

name: San Francisco 49ers Trivia Game
description:
This sports trivia game features a plastic game board that uses a cribbage-style scoring system. Players move up and down the field as they answer questions about this NFL franchise.

Players can adjust the length of a game by changing the number of cards required to complete a "quarter" of play on the gridiron. There are two methods of play with the fast play mechanic allowing a player to keep moving the ball unitl he or she misses a question. The other meachanic has the players alternating play throughout the game.

Optional rules include Goal Line Stands, Interceptions, and Overtime. There are special cardboard dividers placed inside the question card deck to remind the players when halftime and other important points in the game will occur.

Includes the plastic stadium board, score markers, 2400 trivia questions on 400 cards, the time keeping dividers, a storage insert, a die, and rules.
Published in 1996 by Sports Games

name: Alien Panic
description:
Sci-Fi game version of "CLUE".
Your crew are now on the way home. But, unfortunately and as you expected from the classic Sci-Fi movie, one of you are parasited by unknown Alien.
You must find out who is the victim and what alien is now in your ship and what room they are now growing before your ship arrive the Earth.

name: Die Jahreszeiten: Neues Gesellschaftsspiel
description:
The Seasons - A New Partygame

The gameboard consists of 24 squares, in which one can see symbols of the four seasons, different combinations of dice eyes and the amount to bet.

Rules
The participants put 24 chips in a pot, throw dice in sequence, where everyone sees the plan's winnings or losses in the illustrated squares. Who throws 2 times 6 wins the whole game.

name: Die Brautsleute
description:
The bride and groom

At the gameboard one can see ten ovals with people dressed to marry, according to the fashion of the early 19th century in Germany. In the corners one can see dancing couples. In the middle of the gameboard three horses are depicted (Perhaps they are going to pull the wagon with the bride and groom later on!)

Published in Nuremberg, Germany.

name: Der Deutsche Hanswurst
description:
The German Harlequin

In the middle of the gameboard one can see the German harlequin and at the borders his 'relatives': Pickelhäring, Jean Potage, Pierrot, Pulcinello, Jack Pudding and Bajazzo.

Published in Nuremberg, Germany.

name: Das Kleeblatt oder Lumpaci Vagabundus
description:
The Cloverleaf

The gameboard is divided into 11 squares with pictures of funny characters from the theater: Landjunker, Leim, Zwirn & Knieriem, Dorfbarbier, Staberl, Monostatos, Figaro, Jacob, Papageno, Punpernickel, Matz and Lumpaci Vagabundus.

Published in Nuremberg.

name: Der Geizige: Ein Spiel
description:
The covetous

In the middle of the gameboard one can see 'Mr. & Mrs. Covetous' counting money. In eight roundels people are depicted: soldiers, people strolling in the park and people playing music.

name: Die Schwäne: Ein neues Gesellschafts-Spiel
description:
In the middle of the gameboard one can see two swans and around 30 squares with information about winning and losing.

Published in Germany.

name: Die Virtuosen
description:
The virtuoso

The gameboard consists of a large circle with eleven fields, in which musicians are depicted. Dice are also depicted.

Published in Nuremberg, Germany.

name: Bean-opoly
description:
From the Late for the Sky website:

IS THE PLANET SHAKING OR IS IT JUST YOU?

4 out of 5 Americans consume more than 400 million cups of coffee per day! Do we love the bean? Yes we do! We also love the buzz, the taste, the aroma, the ritual...we love everything about the stuff!

BEAN-OPOLY players purchase favorite coffees and paraphernalia then collect Espresso Shots and trade them in for the Good Buzz. Be the owner of the lowly Drive-Thru Decaf or collect the big rent as the proprietor of The Bean. It’s all fun and games until someone leaves the pot empty and heads straight to NO BUZZ!...does not pass Brew!...does not collect $200!

C’mon! There’s too much blood in your coffee stream! Round up family and friends, put on a pot and gather round the Bean-opoly board.
There’s no such thing as too much of a good thing!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Baltimore-Opoly
description:
From the Late for the Sky Website:

We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some crab cakes, great parks, a few festivals, the arts, some BIG FUN... and voilà (vwä lä)-behold; BALTIMORE-OPOLY!
Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round! Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!
Get YOUR Game On, Baltimore!
It's Your Roll!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Rusalka's Sorrow
description:
Dark Age Russia is a land full of epic tragegy, mystery and danger. Can you, as the Knyaz (Lord) of a struggling Province lead it to prosperity and overcome the often horrific events that befall you?

Players assume the roles of Lords in a medieval fantasy Russia. They must get the most out of their populations. To aid them they can hire Specialists like Lumberjacks, Heroes, and the dreaded Witch, and construct buildings including some that may bring them glory. In the end, however, it is the player who best deals with the disasters that befall the Lands that will emerge victorious.

The game includes:
1 Actions Board
1 Events Track
4 Player Boards
20 wooden Action Markers
40 Specialist character cards (16 types)
48 Building tiles (12 types)
16 Event Cards (2 decks)
mechanics: Action Points, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Pola-rink
description:
Magnetic ice hockey game, very similar to the Balyna Super Soccer game produced by Balyna (Toogood and Jones of Whitstable in Kent) in the United Kingdom during the 1950s.

Game consists of:

- playing board
- four adjustable plastic legs to be inserted at each corner of the board
- two plastic goals
- four wooden playing rods with a magnet at the end, two each of red and blue
- ten plastic players with magnets on their bases, usually 5 red and 5 blue players
- a small wooden puck
- rules

Each player has a magnet on the bottom of its base, which was manipulated by a rod (with a magnet on the end of it) which went under the table. The magnets of each team are polarised in reverse, so you cannot affect your opponents players with your rod. The rod is used to drag your players across the board, thus allowing you to push the puck around.

The game board is a smooth hardboard surface, marked out with an ice hockey pitch, and a basic raised surround to stop the puck going out of play.

Good fun - lots frantic action!

name: Grand Jeu de L'Histoire Ancienne de la Grèce
description: A roll and move game from 1 to 63. The whole board game is full of depictions from the Greece history.

name: Spiel verschiedener natürlicher Gegenstände and der grossen Kette der Welt
description: A roll and move game, played in a chain numbered from 1 to 85. In these fields one can see: animals, flowers and other depictions. In the middle of the gameboard a tempietto, a small commemorative martyrium, is depicted.

name: Der Freischütz: Ein Gesellschafts-Spiel
description:
The Marksman or The Freeshooter

A roll and move game played from number 1 to 64. The depictions are from the opera 'Der Freischütz' by Carl Maria von Weber (1786– 1826). A very beautiful boardgame!

name: 3 Stooges
description:
3 Stooges is a 2 player game played on a 6x5 grid of squares, with three cells removed in its of its corners, resulting in a diamond-shaped playing area. Black and white stacking pieces are used; to start the game, the pieces are laid out one to each cell, alternating black and white across the board, but for the long center row of six cells, each of which has two stacked pieces of its color.

On every turn, each player may do one of the following:

Swap the places of any two single, unstacked stones, of either color.
Ko rule - The player cannot swap a stone swapped in the opponent's last move.
Ko rule - After two consecutive swaps, it's illegal to swap again.

Move the upper stone (from a friendly stack of two stones) to an adjacent (orthogonal or diagonal) cell occupied by an isolated friendly stone.


To win, a player must line up three stacks of his own color in a row, orthogonal or diagonal, or stalemate his opponent.

name: Un
description:
Un is a 2 player game played on a 5x5 hexagonal board.
One player drops the neutral stone on a cell and the other chooses who starts.
On each turn,each player slides the neutral stone a number of empty cells in a straight line and each cell passed becomes unavailable for the rest of the game.
The first player that cannot move loses.

name: Das Grosse Ziel
description:
The big goal

A game about life. It starts with birth and ends with death.

Published in Germany.

name: Die Blumenlust oder Floras Tempel: Ein neues Würfelspiel
description: A roll and move game from number 1 to 40. In each field flowers, animals and garden equipments are depicted. In the middle a temple is depicted. In the corners of the gameboard one can see children working in gardens.

name: Neues Jagdspiel
description: A roll and move game from 1 to 45. In the round fields one can see hunting scenes and in the corners hunters.

name: Die Spassvögel und die Glücksvögel: Ein kurzweiliges Gesellschaftspiel
description:
The funbird and the fortunebird

A game from number 1 to 18. In the square one can see depictions of birds and other items. At the goal, number 18, a stork and a baby are depicted.

Published in Nuremberg.

name: Robinsons Reisen zu Wasser und zu Lande, so wie seine Schicksale auf der durch ihn allgemein bekannten wüsten Insel
description:
Robinsons Reisen zu Wasser und zu Lande, so wie seine Schicksale auf der durch ihn allgemein bekannten wüsten Insel - Ein neues und höchst interessantes Post- und Reisespiel zugleich als Bildgalerie zu Campes Robinson, und als Stoff zu belehrenden Gesprächen über Natur- und Völker- kunde nutzbar mit deutlicher Erklärung des Spiels und einer Cassentabelle

A roll and move game based on 'The Life and Strange Surprizing Adventures of Robinson Crusoe of York, Mariner: Who lived Eight and Twenty Years, all alone in an un-inhabited Island on the coast of America, near the Mouth of the Great River of Oroonoque; Having been cast on Shore by Shipwreck, where-in all the Men perished but himself. With An Account how he was at last as strangely deliver'd by Pyrates. Written by Himself, or simply Robinson Crusoe, is a novel by Daniel Defoe.' A roll and move game from number 1 to 80.

Published in Dresden.

name: Norderneyer Spiel oder die Reisse in's Seebad
description:
The Nordeneyer Game or the travel to the Seaside Resort

A roll and move game from number 1 to 39. In the squares one can see depictions of the life at the coast in summer.


Norderneyer Seegat connects the North Sea and the Wattenmeer between the East Friesian Islands of Juist and Norderney.
publishers: Georg Nikolaus Renner, Verlag G.N. Renner

name: Die Reise nach den Pyramiden
description: A roll and move game from number 1 to 21. At the gameboard one can see depictions from different parts of Egypt. Rules in German and French. Published in Germany.

name: Der Hühnerhof
description:
A roll and move game played from number 1 to 73. All depictions are from the hen run.

Published in Nuremberg.

name: Robinson
description:
A roll and move game based on 'The Life and Strange Surprizing Adventures of Robinson Crusoe of York, Mariner: Who lived Eight and Twenty Years, all alone in an un-inhabited Island on the coast of America, near the Mouth of the Great River of Oroonoque; Having been cast on Shore by Shipwreck, where-in all the Men perished but himself. With An Account how he was at last as strangely deliver'd by Pyrates. Written by Himself, or simply Robinson Crusoe, is a novel by Daniel Defoe.' You play the game from number 1 to 30.

Published in Mainz, Germany.

name: Neuestes Ritter- Turnier- und Sarazenen-Spiel
description: A roll and move game played from number 1 to 94. At the gameboard one can see depictions of the life of a knight.

name: Fire Trivia Game
description:
Similar to Trivial Pursuit but with a questions regarding fire. The object of the game is to successfully obtain a full set of six pawns (one from each category) to "man" your fire engine, then proceed to the center of the board and answera question to "put out the fire". The categories are:
Fire Apparatus
Tactics
Safety
Industrial Fire Protection
General Fire Service
Building Construction

name: Die Englische Parforce-Jagd
description:
An English Chase on Horseback

A race game, where the gameboard has five tracks, 12 squares long. You race with a hunter, a dog or a deer. Rules in four languages.

Published in Germany.

name: Word Bank
description:
User Summary...

An Anagrams style game of moving around the board and spelling words.

name: Emmerdale DVD Game
description:
Test your knowledge of ITV's longest running and most popular soap opera, Emmerdale. A fun quiz for the whole family, the game features more than 700 questions and classic clips from the show, with an emphasis on the contemporary storylines.

Choose from a selection of characters, but beware who you choose because there are forfeits for bad behaviour!
Multiple choice, time-based, questions based around clips, stills and storylines from the '70s to the current incarnation
6 categories of question: Families, workplace, romance, the Woolpack, feuds and friendship
'Superfan' section to test the real addicts!

Contents:
DVD Game
12 'Bar Quiz' Style Beer Mats
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: All About Raleigh, North Carolina
description: Like other "All About Town" game, learn all about Raleigh, North Carolina (in 1982) with this "Exciting, Fast Moving Game for the Entire Family." The largish 6-piece board shows the major streets of downtown with businesses at the appropriate locations. The object is to travel on the playing board to the shopping locations shown on your Shopping List.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Babylon: Gateway of the Gods
description:
Epic building in the magnificent city of Babylon.

Players, as nobles of the city, begin with a small pool of Workers, which they assign to a variety of roles in order to earn silver Talents and prestige. They compete with one another to contribute the most resources toward building Babylon's great works, such as the Hanging Gardens and the Ishtar Gate. To do so they will need to expand their pool of Workers, construct Buildings that make more efficient use of their Resources, arrange Caravan and Shipping expeditions to bring goods back to the city, and deal with the Events that befall the lands.

The game includes:
Game Board
80 Worker markers (12 in each player color)
80 Contributor markers (20 in each player color)
4 Player Tableaus
8 Boats
8 Camels
various Resource chips
40 Event Cards
100 silver Talents

name: Super 3 Game Box
description: 3 simple games for children come in 1 box: Jet Squadron, Rockets around the Moon and Uranium. The game play is nothing but roll and move but the graphic presentation is appealing.

name: À vous de jouer
