description: French cycling themed game that was published for ProTour team Caisse d'épargne. In this game that is played on the beach the players first draw a track in the sand. Then they use a sort of marble that is flicked in a similar way as the famous Carabande game. The marble determines the positing of the cyclists (pawns). He who reaches the finish first wins.

name: Californiaopoly
description: California Monopoly with an extremely colorful game board. Includes: Deck of Fate Cards, Deck of Property Cards, 6 Playing Pieces, 15 Skyscrapers, 15 Redding Bungalows, 15 Eureka Bungalows, 2 Dice & Play Money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Plumb Crazy
description:
Simple spin and move game with a cool 3D spinner.

Contents:

BIG 15 X 15 Game Board
4 Friendly Plumber Game Pieces
Swing Around Spinner

name: Battle Royale II
description:
Card game base on the move Battle Royale II. It follows Battle Royal.
Players are students and try to kill each other. The last one standing wins the game.

There are terrorist cards placed in the middle of the board. Players have a team of student-cards. Each team tries with different weapon cards to destroy their opponents or the terrorists. The weapon cards are held in the hand. A player which loses all of his/her student-cards loses the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Coeur de Lion
description: Wargaming rules for the Crusades era, 1000-1300 A.D. Ground scale is 1 inch = 10 yards. Figure scale is 1 figure = 20 men. Time scale is 1 turn = 15 minutes time. 28 pages.

name: Crystal Core: Battle for Nih'ki
description:
From the designer's website:

Crystal Core: Battle for Nih'ki is a tactical wargame for two to four players.

Players battle for control of various objective zones, using one of four factions: the Daiseep, Humans, Khelons, and Saahrai. Each force is commanded by one or two Heroes, and features a number of Troopers and/or Vehicles. In the advanced game mode, players can select armoury cards to provide their units or their whole force with unique abilities.

Crystal Core features simulated parallel play through the use of command cards, which are selected simultaneously by each player, and define what actions are available for that round. Players must devise a plan for each round, and execute it with a focus on army-cohesion and maneuvering for prime position to achieve victory.

The game also provides a superior wargaming experience by eliminating several of the upkeep actions associated with wargames, including model-per-model movement, excessive dice rolls, and army wide actions, thereby providing maximum entertainment in a modest timeframe.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Trivia in a Trunk: The Holiday Trivia Game
description:
From the back of the box: "The ultimate trivia fan's stocking stuffer. Everything from your favorite carols to holiday movies, tradition and history. A game for the whole family to play during the Ho-Ho-Holidays!"

Comes with 200 cards, each has three questions (one in each of the following categories: Trees, Candles, Bells. Hint the category names are not too intuitive. For instance "Candles" focuses on Holiday Movies & TV Specials.

An additional twist has a "Take 2" on some questions meaning that in order to score points you have to answer both parts correctly.

name: Tales of Titans
description:
Adventure fantasy board game system.

Welcome to world where each intelligent race worship titans as gods. Brave Humans, Dare Trolls, Furious Orcs still at war with Deceitful Centaurs, Little Kobolds digging earth and Noble Werecats. All of them will face threat of Dark Titan cult.

First scenario: Trials
In first scenario players will be able to lead four different characters: the chosen ones: Human swordsman, Human wizard apprentice, Troll hunter and Troll shaman, to complete series of tasks to please their Titan.

Highlights:
- modular board (each game can be different)
- game system with open world allowing easy prepare new scenarios, new encounters, new rewards
- brand new fight system
- competition play with cooperation elements
- best ideas from WoW:TBG, WoW:TAG, Runebound and Descent:RTL in one with some unseen solutions.
- different in gamefactions and reputation system
- different style of play for each character (swordsman with combo points, shaman with totems)

More information on blog:
http://bri-gryplanszowe.blogspot.com/
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Letter-Word-Picture
description:
Letter-Word-Picture is a fun and competitive game for boys, girls and the whole family. In this game you learn many things! It is a means for developing language skills. The child learns new words with the help of the pictures. By matching pictures to words, the child develops verbal expression, enriches his/her vocabulary and concepts, differentiates between words and becomes familiar with the letters of the alphabet. By placing letters in the correct order to match pictures, the child learns to spell words correctly.
Aims: 1. To learn the letters of the alphabet. 2. To put letters together to make words. 3. To match words to pictures.
From the back of the box.

name: Rikado
description:
From the instructions:

"Dexterity and concentration game with chopsticks and Rikado grains for children and grown-ups."

"Objective of the game: Who can handle the chopsticks skillfully and gain most of the Rikado grains and score most points?"

Players use chopsticks to pick up a wooden Rikado rice grain and move it to their area. If they drop it or move other rice grains, their turn ends.

Components include: oblong wooden "rice grains": 19 natural wooden color, 12 red, 5 black, 2 violet, 1 silver; 4 pairs of chopsticks, 1 felt base, 1 long cord, 4 short cords

This is a German game, but the rules are translated into English, French, and Dutch.

name: Around The Table
description:
This is a Bible memory game with a Christian theme.

Players move around a colorful board bearing a representation of a table loaded with food. They draw illustrated cards which are specially designed to help the players "see" the answers to the Biblical questions. The cards use cartoon images and a "sound-alike" word system to trigger the formation of a strong memeory pattern. The first player to correctly answer eight questions and place a marker on all eight place settings on the table is the winner.

Includes the board, 8 pawns, 64 chips, cards, rules, die, and a storage insert.

The game can be enjoyed by teams in a classroom setting.

name: Spacetrax
description:
A quiz game with a space themed board.

Contents include:

120 Fuel Units (markers)
1 Set of Question Cards
1 Set of Mission Cards
2 Dice
6 Spacecraft (game pieces)
6 Interplanetary Passports
6 Crayons

name: Landfill
description:
Simple track movement game labeled as a 'training game'.

Contents include:

4 Player Pieces
18 Technical Cards
18 People Cards
11 Briefing Cards
12 Blue Discs
Die
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Metropolitan's Group Insurance game
description: Track movement game to teach you the urgency of buying insurance!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Span It
description: Simple mountain climbing game for children. Game board is an insert inside the box, but it is very graphically appealing.

name: Small's Round Australia Motor Contest
description: This game circa 1925 is an advertizing game and comes from the Small's Chocolate Company. The ad on the box states that "Small's make Club, Family and Jersey Milk Chocolate" and another states that "Small's make great chocolates". The object of this game was to motor around Australia, buying and eating chocolate all the way by rolling dice.

name: Bomber: The Big Power Game
description:
Bomber The Big Power Game is a Game of Board Warfare.

The object of the game is to destroy by bombing all bases that have been acquired by your ppponents or by destroying all of their aircraft.

You win the game by being the sole survivor in the game, by holding any base or aircraft.

The game combines elements of luck and skill.

Conducting diplomacy between players while trying to develop alliances through pacts with other players and the trading of both Credential Cards of Title and equipment is what will lead you to tactical advantages over your opponents which will eventually lead you to victory

Game Contents
Game Board.
Briefing Cards - Bombers/Fighter Bomber's.
Pack of Title Cards.
Set of Pact Cards.
4 Sets of Playing Counter's.
Arms Factory Tokens.
Oil Refinery Tokens.
Army Dump Tokens.
Oil Dump Tokens.
2 Dice.

name: The International Horse Race
description:
From the box...

"2 Great Games in One"

2 Action Packed Magnetic Board Games - The International Steeple Chase & The International Stakes Race.

Playing the Games:

The Dice - The six dice used in this game will control the speed of the horses as they move around the track. The Luck of each jockey every time they roll the dice controls their horses chance to win.

The Track - Every space on the track that a horse can land on during the race will help or hinder their jockey in the battle to win.

The Jockey - You are the jockey that brings your horse home a winner. You've beaten all the obstacles and the other jockeys. You belong in the Winner's Circle...

Game Equipment:
Magnetic race tracks
Flat track & Steeple chase
6 - magnetic race horses
6 - horse identity color cards
6 - game dice
1 - dice tray
1 - instruction booklet
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Knapp Electric Questioner
description:
(Info from Ebayer deedavermont) One of the first electric quiz games (circa 1920), the Knapp Electric Questioner had various sets of quiz cards ranging from flags to animals to trivia.
Upon completing the circuit by touching the two probes to the correct question and answer a buzzer would sound.
The game also included a Morse code key with the code printed on the inside lid for your convenience.

name: Let's Get Dressed
description: This is an easy race game for 2 to 4 players ages 5 to 9. Spin the simple spinner and then move the number of spaces to the finish line.

name: Fractions are Fun
description: Spin the spinner and find the fraction pieces to complete your pie. (Similar to Fun with Pizza Fractions by Learning Resources). This game is different in how you play the game which is meant for players from the 2nd to the 7th grade.

name: MMA Master
description:
MMA Master is a board/card game that simulates Mixed Martial Arts in the cage. The game is designed to be easy-to-learn and quick to play. MMA Master is a 2 player game for ages 12 and up.
The game allows players to'design' their own fighter using cards depicting a wide variety of moves, strikes, grappling, and character traits. The cards are compared and a die is rolled to indicate the various outcomes. Damage, KO's, or submissions are recorded to determine the winner over a number of rounds.

Four expansions allow the players to add new moves from a variety of mixed martial arts to further 'specialize' their fighter in the players favorite style of cage combat.

(Publisher/Designer summary)

name: Twisty Passages
description:
You’re lost in a maze of twisty passages, all alike. Escape in this unusual card-and-dice game for two to four bewildered explorers.

Story
You, and at least one other person like you, have been dumped into a maze of twisty passages. The first person to find the exit is the only one who will be allowed to leave. The maze may be filled with interesting things to see, but you don’t want to make it your home.

Goal
As you explore the maze, you’ll accumulate cards. These cards represent your progress toward the maze’s exit. The first person to accumulate a set number of cards is the first to the exit and wins the game.

(Source: Publisher's Website)
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play, Racing

name: Ten Sports Games To Play With Dice
description:
From the "Letter from the author" page:
"The games included in this 'Ten Sports Games To Play With Dice' have been developed and played by my family and friends for over 20 years. Foregoing the more traditional board games which sell for five and ten dollars and more, we would take our pencil and paper and a pair of dice and develop a game of our own. This way, we could make the game suit whatever mood we were in. Being avid sports fans like yourself, we often developed different sports games that we could use to capture the excitement of real sports. So over the years we gradually accumulated the rules for dice games in nearly every popular sport."

Includes the following games:

Dice Baseball
Dice Football
Dice Basketball by Players
Dice Hockey
Dice Basketball - Scholastic Quarters
Dice Soccer
Dice Baseball - Team Play
Dice Basketball - Professional
Dice Bowling
Dice Wrestling

name: Read the Clock! Time Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Students read the clock and race to stay on schedule—strengthening time-telling skills as they play! In this skill-building math game, players match clock cards to times printed on the game board…and race through a day of exciting activities. The first player to match up all of her clock pieces wins the game!"

Game Components include:
Game Board
24 clock cards
24 time word cards
Answer card
4 playing pawns
1 six sided die

Read the Clock allows players to choose from three possible games:

Game #1: Watch the Clock!
Players race to match clock cards to the times shown on the game board.

Game #2: What Time Is It?
Players race to match time word cards to the times shown on the game board.

Game#3: Time Masters
An advanced game using both time word cards and clock cards.

name: Making Cents Money Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Students race to fill up their piggy banks—and polish their money skills as they play! In our skill-building game, players work out money problems with realistic coins…and write the answers on their piggy bank cards. The first player to fill up a piggy bank card wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
45 plastic coins
32 game cards
4 write & wipe bank cards
4 write & wipe markers
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die

Advanced Play Variant:
Play continues until all players have filled in all 8 lines on their piggy banks cards. Players add up their money. The player with the most money in the bank wins.

name: Habitat Challenge: A Life Science Game
description:
Publishers Description:
"Who will be the first explorer to sail to the polar ice cap? It could be you…if you can answer questions about animals and their habitats correctly! In this skill-building game, students answer fascinating life science questions to move around the game board from one habitat to the next…then slip the question cards in the secret decoder to check their answers"

Game components:
Game board
50 question cards
Secret decoder
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die

name: Synonym & Antonym Safari Adventure Vocabulary Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Players journey deep into the jungle to hunt for synonyms and antonyms-building essential vocabulary skills as they play! To play, students draw game cards and match them to either synonyms or antonyms on the board. The first player to find a match for all of her cards wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
48 game cards
4 Game pawns
1 spinner
Reference list of words

Players may choose from one of three possible games:

Game #1: Synonym Adventure
Players match game cards to their synonyms on the game board.

Game #2: Antonym Adventure
Players match antonym game cards to their opposite on the game board.

Game #3: Advanced Play
Players use both Antonym and Synonym cards.

name: Prefix Pitfall Vocabulary Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Players race to reach the safety of the temple by matching prefixes to root words—building essential vocabulary skills as they play! To play, students roll prefix dice and match them to root words on the game board…then build each new word on their write & wipe game cards. The player to build the most words wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
4 prefix with 11 prefixes
4 write & wipe game cards
4 write & wipe markers
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die
Word list

name: Using Context Clues: Riddle of the Ruins Vocabulary Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Players solve the riddle of the ancient ruins by deciphering clues and defining words—building essential vocabulary skills as they play! To play, students draw game cards and use context clues to answer each question…then slip the card into the secret decoder to reveal the answer. Students roll the die and move around the game board with each correct answer…and the first player to reach the Sphinx wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
50 context clue game cards
1 secret decoder
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die

name: Sunken Suffixes Vocabulary Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Players search for pirate's treasure by matching suffixes to root words—building essential vocabulary skills as they play! To play, students try to match suffixes on their game cards to root words on the board…then build each new word on their write & wipe cards. The player to build the most words wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
45 suffix cards
4 write & wipe game cards
4 write & wipe markers
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die
Word list

name: What's the Matter?: Physical Science Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Who will be the first to find the perfect potion? It could be you…if you can correctly identify the properties of matter! In this skill-building game, students answer physical science questions to move around the game board…then slip the quiz cards in the secret decoder to check their answers."

Game components:
Game board
50 quiz cards
Secret decoder
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die

name: Out of This World: Earth & Space Science Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Who will be the first astronaut to reach the edge of the solar system? It could be you…if you answer questions about earth and space science correctly! In this skill-building game, students travel through the solar system by answering questions about the earth’s properties, planets, stars and more……then slip the quiz cards in the secret decoder to check their answers."

Game components:
Game board
44 question cards
20 planet challenge cards
4 Game pawns
Secret decoder
1 six sided die

name: Fraction of the Pizza Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Players dish up a delicious looking pizza pie—and get plenty of hands-on practice with fractions! To play our skill-building math game, students draw fraction picture cards and match them to numeric fractions on the game board. The first player to match up all of their fractions wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
30 game cards
1 spinner
Answer card
4 Game pawns

name: Fang den Fisch
description:
Note from the box:

Players in turn roll the die and then simultaneously try to catch the fish shown on the die. If a wrong fish has been caught it must be back into the ring. The first player to catch 2 fish has won the game. For smaller children the die can beleft out, the game ends when all fish have been caught, the player with the most fish wins the game. If more than two are playing, everybody plays against everybody else, who wins the most duels?
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice

name: Märchenzeit
description: Card game collection with well known games, the cards are decorated with fairy tale characters, the cards can be used for the following games: Zwergen-Mau-Mau, Prinzessinen-Quartett and Märchenmemo.

name: Lilla Miljöspelet
description:
The Little Environmental Game

Play the game and learn about how the milk affects the environment. The path from 'Start' to 'Goal' [Mål] are not numbered at the gameboard, but you actually move your counter from circle number 1 to number 78. The gameboard is illustrated with: cows, trucks, a tractor, farms, a school, a dairy, a shop and other features. At some circles an event occur, as for example at circle number 14: 'It's written 'Mikl' in stead of 'Milk' at the packages. Don't move your counter next turn and revise the typo.

The game is published by the largest producer of dairy products in Scandinavia, Arla Foods, and the purpose with the publishing is to show how environmentally friendly the company is.

name: Pitfalls
description:
Pitfalls: The Magnet Maze, Hard on the Hands, Easy on the Eyes.
...Call it a Puzzle
...Call it a Game
...Call it a Sculpture
...But watch out for

Pitfalls

Here is a puzzle as handsome as it is challenging. The object is to lead a steel ball through a maze by means of a magnetic wand without letting the ball fall into the pitfalls along the way. It's a game to test your manual dexterity, concentration and coordination of eye-and-hand. Challenge your family, friends, boss and secretary to see who can get the highest score. When at rest, Pitfalls makes an handsome accent to your home or office.

name: Terry and the Pirates
description:
User summary...

"A Sunday Funnies Game"

Game based on the comic strip which ran from 1934-1973 with two different cartoonists.

The game itself involves moving around a block maze and picking up treasures.

name: Insecto
description:
INSECTO is like first board games for children. It is the great insect race with this 2-sided magnetized board game with plush insects and useful carrying case. It initiates youngsters to board games and develops concentration and dexterity.
Insecto is an ideal travel game with 2 interesting ways to play:

BUZZY BUZZY BEEZ

Bees go from flower to flower all day long in search of the precious nectar. At the end of the day, it is a race to return to the nest. Which bee will be the first to enter the nest?

Each player advances his bee the number of flowers indicated by the number on the die. Every time a bee stops on a flower where the tail end of a caterpillar is found, this bee must slide down to the flower where the head of the caterpillar is found. Every time a bee stops on a flower where a butterfly is found, this bee must follow the butterflies to the other flower. But take care to the spider webs or your bee will skip a turn! The first bee to enter the nest wins the game.

VEGGIE LAND

Ladybugs are very useful in a vegetable garden as they feed on harmful insects. VEGGIE LAND is a simple game that is captivating, yet easy to play for kids 3 years of age and up. It does not require any reading or counting skills.

On his turn, each player rolls the die and moves forward to the next vegetable illustrated on the die. On certain vegetables, there is a spider! If a player stops on a vegetable with a spider, he must skip a turn. But if a player stops on a vegetable with a ladybug, he plays again! Then, a few vegetables come in pair. If a player stops on pair of vegetables, he moves forward to the next single similar vegetable. The first ladybug (player) to reach the vegetable cart wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Racing, Trains, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mean Streets
description: Set in the 1920's in Chicago, players in this game purchase businesses at auction, placing them into a map of the city to try and get the highest property values possible. They also bribe, blackmail and purchase their way onto five organizations in the city, including the Mafia, the Bureau, and the City Newspaper, which allow them different actions they can take to boost their own properties and sabotage others. They can even become the Mayor, or the Don!

name: Barbie: World of Models
description:
Girls game of how to become a model.
It features a 3D game board with a catwalk. Every Barbie/player has a set of cards, which she has to play in order to win. The players take turns and draw one card from the opponent and one from hers pile.

name: Name That Word! Vocabulary Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Children build language skills, improve vocabulary and more…as they give clues and try to guess mystery words! In this fun-filled board game, kids play with partners or teams, drawing photo-word cards in 8 categories including actions, emotions and everyday objects. Players then describe or act out the word to their teammates…and try to guess the most words by the end of the game!"

Game components:
Game board
140 photo game cards
6 game pawns
1 six sided die
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: All Around Town Sorting Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Children develop sorting, classifying and thinking skills as they travel around a fun-filled town—from the supermarket to the bookstore! In this lively board game, players move from one store to the next, collecting items such as clothing, books and art supplies. They sort the items onto storefronts on their game mats…and race to become the first player to collect an item from every store!"

Game components:
Game board
4 activity mats
30 item cards
30 number cards
4 game pawns
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Key Education Publishing, Lakeshore Learning Materials

name: Battle of the Planets
description:
Take control of a fleet of ships and move across the obstacle filled battle field in attempt to beat your opponent to the goal. This fast paced game is based on the "Battle of the Planets" animated series (also called Gatchaman, G-Force and Eagle Riders) and is filled with unique artwork based on the animated series.

The game is subtitled H Omada "G" or The "G" Team.

name: Fire Station Dalmatian Early Math Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Children build tons of essential math skills…as they race to collect, count, add and subtract spots on friendly Dalmatians! In this lively board game, players move around the board to the fire station, adding or subtracting spots on their Dalmatians as they go. When everyone has reached the station, they count up their spots…and the dog with the most spots gets to be the Fire Station Dalmatian!"

Game components:
Game board
25 game cards
70+ Dalmatian spots
4 Game pawns

name: Space Station Sight-Word Game
description:
Publishers description:
"Children practice reading tons of essential sight-words…as they race to explore an alien space station! In this lively game, players take turns flipping over alien cards and spaceship cards on the game board, then reading the words printed on back. If the two words match, players get to keep the cards…and try to collect the most cards by the end of the game!"

Game components:
Game board
90+ color-coded game cards (two levels of play)

name: Der Zankapfel
description:
Der Zankapfel is a tile placement game, in which players build trees with hexagonal limb cards.
During the phases spring, summer, and autumn, depending on a dice roll, you can place limbs (straight, bend, broken), apples or special tiles like beehives. The player who harvests the most apples (and gets a bonus form specials like the hive) wins the game.

name: Zogaj
description:
This game is played in two phases. In the first phase all players memorize pairs of tiles with different icons (or triplets or even bigger groups for extra complexity). The pairs are then flipped over and mixed. The example in the rulebook is for instance the pair: tea pot + couch
In the second phase the players take turns flipping two tiles - if one of the pairs were flipped the player keeps it and flips another pair (flip triplets when playing the more difficult variant). The player with most pairs when all tiles are taken wins the game.

beginner variant 10-12 pairs, normal 20 pairs and expert 30 pairs.


From zogaj.se/zogaj-shopen

The Game that teaches you how to use your hidden memory powers while having fun! You will be surprised over how easy it is and how powerful your brain is when used correctly. This game teaches you how to think.

The Game is suitable for all ages. It is perfect as a family-game but also for adults who wants to see how others think. The game is also a powerful learning tool for the person who wants to show grown-ups as well as children how Active Memory techniques works and how one can start to develop a super-memory.

name: Chick N Derby
description: Rev up Your engines for Chick N Derby, a colorful new family board game where chickens don crash helmets and get behind the wheel in an attempt to be the first to cross the finish line with all of their five Letters lined up to spell D-E-R-B-Y. - Back of Box

name: Panorama
description: This game is a "War-Peace" strategy game. Each player starts the game with a unique "Sealed Orders" sheet which assigns that player a specific color of units, and a list of 4-6 "Peaceful" objectives or 4-6 "War / Agressor" objectives. Each player selects a secret objective from their list. Players then take turns placing their units, trying to capture opponents units or to reach their objective. When a player reaches their objective the game ends and all players add up their victory points to determine the winner.
publishers: The Cavalcade of Games Publishing Company

name: Go-Kart Rally Sight-Words Game: Grade 2
description:
Publisher description:

"A fun way to learn sight-words, build vocabulary, and increase reading fluency.

As students race around the game board, they get hands-on practice using sight-words in context! The game is super-easy to play—students just move around the board, landing on spaces printed with 40 grade-appropriate sight-words. Each time they land on one, students try to use it in a sentence on their game cards. The first one to complete all 8 sentences wins!"

Game components:
Game board
10 write and wipe cards
4 write and wipe markers
4 Game pawns
1 six-sided die

name: Rusalka
description: You are a peasant looking for herbs in forests. You meet mythological beings from Slavic mythology like Rusalka and Lešij. This is a small game that was published inside a book about Slavic mythology titled Nebeski Dvori i Zemaljske Vode- Tragovima Slavenske Mitologije (Heavenly Courts and Earthly Waters: Traces of Slavic Mythology). Your goal is to collect the most herbs and to be the first one to tell your village that you saw the Rusalka, fairy, Lešij, etc. You can enchant other players with the help of the mythological beings or steal other players herbs. There is a moment when you have to be first to say "Ir" to defend your self from snake bite!
mechanics: Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Monster Math Add and Subtract
description: Take part in an island adventure that is both fun and challenging! Determine which basic facts children need to master and then select the cards for one of four skill levels: sums to 10, sums 11 to 18, minuends to 10 and minuends 11 to 18. Players take turns uncovering the board by answering and matching game cards correctly and see the funny antics of delightful monsters.

name: I Spy Alphabet Aquarium
description: Learn letters and beginning letter sounds by matching colorful fish cards to the correct letters or images on the aquarium game board. Three ways to play: match uppercase letters to each other, match uppercase letters to lowercase letters, or match letters to pictures of things with that beginning letter sound. Includes large game board, game cards, markers, and directions.

name: Jim Prentice Electric Baseball Model 48-B
description:
This game is very similar to Jim Prentice Electric Baseball Model 505, however the pitcher physically rolls a steel ball to down a pathway on the board and the batter has to push a button that will trap the ball between the 'bat' and a contact. With a successful 'hit' various lights will light up either singly or in combination, indicating the outcome of the play. If the batter misses the ball, the pitch can be a strike if it stops in front of a small rise in the pitching track. If the ball goes past the rise, then it is considered a ball.

This introduces some dexterity into the gameplay rather than the outcome being determined by electronics

name: Feuerwehr
description:
Fire Brigade from Haba - Fifo, the fire dragon, is playing with matches. Suddenly, flames are everywhere and the alarm bells are ringing. Who will help the brave firemen fight the blaze? Three suggestions for playing, assigning, puzzling and observing closely. For one child and an adult.

Game & Puzzle: with game and puzzle HABA combines three classic product groups into a new innovative series. The articles each contain three thematically conceived child-adopted game ideas of increasing degree of difficulty. - classifying game aged 2+ - simple dice game aged 3+ - jigsaw puzzle and searching game aged 4+ As children grow they keep on learning and the game ideas of Game & Puzzle therefore continues to be a stimulating toy over a long time.

name: Manufactura
description:
Manufactura is the game that stimulates the productive processes of a factory and the commercialization of its products to the market. It demonstrates the importance of the Lean production, in other words, it shows the concept of producing in a Lean way. This concept was originated with the Toyota Production System and aims at increasing the speed of the processes, eliminating waste and reducing costs.

In the game, the players are presidents of companies which need to produce their products and sell them to the clients. These clients, however, only buy from companies that offer the lower prices. To offer competitive prices, they will have to improve their factories, which present limited production capacity and serious quality problems. The secret is to produce faster, better and with a lower cost. The person who achieves the greater total income is the winner.

Manufactura may be played by all employees who are part of the productive area of a company, or by those who are just curious about its operational system. With this game, they will all learn and know the Lean culture and its advantages and benefits.

name: Inside ISO 9001
description:
Inside ISO 9001 is the game about the ISO 9001, which provides guidelines on how to administrate and assure the quality of products and processes. This approach allows the company in question to improve its quality and to increase its productivity and its clients’ satisfaction.

While playing, the participants compete against each other on a fictional race to see who is the first to achieve the certification. The players are challenged to answer correctly to ISO 9001 related questions. The person who first reaches the certification, in other words, the end of the path, is the winner.

Inside ISO 9001 is recommended to companies and professionals who are interested on the quality system, or who are facing a certification process. The game is a tool to people who are learning about the ISO 9001 and to those are already acquainted with the process but would like to improve their knowledge. The game can also be used as advertisement and celebration tool for those companies that just conquered the certification.

name: White Belts Combat
description:
White Belts Combat is the board game in which the White Belts duel in a battle of martial arts and of knowledge over the Six Sigma fundaments. The dispute stage is an oriental temple and the winner is the one who combines the best punches with the most precise answers.

The game was developed for combat between two fighters. They get on to a mat and the aim is to throw one’s opponent off it. To do so, one must answer the questions correctly and strike the strongest punch.

White Belts Combat is ideally distributed to company White Belts. With this game, these professionals may deepen, perfect or recycle their knowledge on Six Sigma. Besides, this product aims to promote or revitalize the Six Sigma programs within the organization.

name: Belts Challenge
description:
Belts Challenge is a game of strategy and knowledge. In order to win, the players must combine their strategic skills with a good measure of Six Sigma knowledge.

In this game, each player starts by receiving a card with aims and resources to be applied. The aims are linked to the improvement of the company processes. During the game, the players answer the questions correctly, the resources bet in each round are incorporated into the process and the improvement is therefore made. The players thus get more resources to be applied. If, on the other hand, they answer the questions incorrectly, the resources are wasted, which means that they do not remain in the processes and the players are not entitled to new resources. The winner is the one who first completes the three proposed objectives..

This game’s players are Green Belts and Black Belts and they will have an excellent opportunity to challenge their knowledge and company management resource skills while going after a stipulated objective.

name: Inside 14001
description:
Inside ISO 14001 is the game in which players will have the opportunity to know more about the requirements and characteristics of this norm and will go through the experience of a fictitious certification process through a race. The winner will be the first to reach the final ISO 14001 certification process.

Through this game, players learn what requirements are and get to know some of them, what conformable and non conformable situations are, and players also become aware that it is the people and their attitudes that result in the success of ISO 1400.

This game is interesting for companies that are already ISO 14001 and for those going through the process of becoming ISO 14001.Inside ISO 14001 helps employee awareness and adaptation to the contents and details of this norm.

name: Climate Game
description:
Climate Game is a game which when played with strategy, negotiation and diplomacy, challenges its players to save the world from imminent destruction. With everyone’s effort and awareness, the emission of carbonic gas can be reduced before it is too late.

This game is both one of competition and of cooperation. It promotes competition because the player who emits no carbonic gas at all is the winner. But, integrated work of all the other participants is essential in order not to exceed the gas limits of the greenhouse effect that the planet can put up with. If this limit is exceeded, the Earth’s temperature will have risen to a level where human life is not possible and everyone dies/loses.

Therefore, participants must have a good degree of knowledge regarding gas emission and the greenhouse effect and also be very good at negotiating and formulating strategies.

name: Eco Planet
description:
Eco Planet is a board game aimed at environment preservation awareness. The players have a race to see who gets to Eco Planet first, which is an ecologically tolerable place. In order to get there, the players must know the causes, effects, consequences and solutions for the planet’s degradation.

There are five theme groups: air, water, soil, global warming and environmental awareness. When a player gets the correct answers to the questions asked about the theme he/she is on, he/she moves forward on the board.

Eco Planet may be distributed to employees, clients, suppliers, partners and to the community for the promotion of the planet preservation idea. This game can and must be taken home and played with the whole family and with friends.

http://www.games4b.com/ecoplanet.php

name: O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA
description:
O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA é o jogo que fala sobre a CIPA Comissão Interna de Prevenção de Acidentes. Essa norma tem como objetivo a prevenção de acidentes e doenças decorrentes do trabalho, de modo a tornar compatível permanentemente o trabalho com a preservação da vida e a promoção da saúde do trabalhador.

No jogo os participantes concorrem para ver quem será o primeiro a atravessar a trilha da CIPA. Para avançar no tabuleiro é necessário acertar as perguntas que falam dos vários temas: principais normas regulamentadoras, equipamentos de proteção, mapa de risco, classe de fogo, universo CIPA e áreas da fábrica. Durante o jogo, os papeis desempenhados pelos participantes, que são os mesmos na CIPA de verdade, vão se alternando, o que aumenta a emoção do jogo.

O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA é um jogo que deve ser distribuído para os cipeiros e para os funcionários das empresas como forma de conscientização para os perigos e os riscos do ambiente de trabalho, assim como para a educação do uso dos equipamentos de segurança individual ou coletiva. É um jogo que pode ser distribuído como brinde nas SIPATs (Semana Interna de Prevenção de Acidentes do Trabalho), em eleições da CIPA, ou mesmo em aniversários e comemorações relacionadas às metas de segurança da empresa.

Assim, o Quem Sabe PartiCIPA é o jogo ideal para a promoção da cultura da segurança do trabalho. Lembre-se que acidentes podem ser prevenidos pelo seu conhecimento e atitude! A segurança de todos depende de você e do treinamento da sua equipe. Bom jogo.


O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA is the game that talks about the CIPA Committee for the Prevention of Accidents. This standard aims at preventing accidents and illnesses resulting from work in order to make it compatible to work permanently with the preservation of life and the promotion of occupational health.

In the game the participants compete to see who will be the first to cross the path of CIPA. To advance on the board, you must set the questions that speak of various subjects: major regulatory standards, protective equipment, risk map, class of fire, the universe and CIPA areas of the factory. During the game, the roles played by participants, which are the same in real CIPA, will be switching, which increases the excitement of the game.

O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA is a game that should be distributed to the accident prevention commission and employees of companies such as awareness of the dangers and risks of the workplace, as well as for the education of use of safety equipment individually or collectively. It is a game that can be distributed as a gift in SIPATs (Week for the Prevention of Accidents at Work), in elections of CIPA, or even birthdays and celebrations related to the security goals of the company.

Thus, knowing O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA is the ideal game for the promotion of culture of safety. Remember that accidents can be prevented by their knowledge and attitude! The safety of all depends on you and training your team. Good game.

name: Basic Action Super Heroes! Sci-Fi Edition
description:
This is a Sci-Fi themed variant of the original Basic Action Super Heroes! game.

The basic mechanic is rolling 2d6 and multiplying the result by the appropriate stat (Brawn, Agility, or Mind) plus any applicable modifiers and beating a target number. Simple and easy.

Characters are built on points. While there are plenty of options here, it won't take you hours to build a character and you could jot all relevant stats down on a 3x5 index card.

This version includes guides for creating alien races. There are also rules for starship combat. Scenarios range from Victorian Steampunky Sci-Fi to Sci-Fi Fantasy to Post Apocolyptic genre.

name: Five Star Final
description:
This newspaper-themed board game was based on 1931 movie "Five Star Final". The game includes a large (30" x 17") and heavy board, five player tokens, 40 Service Tokens, a deck of yellow Assignment Cards, and a deck of white News Cards.

Players take Assignment Cards from the Editor that show events underway around the board. They then choose how to travel there: by foot, bus, elevated, taxi or subway. By foot is slowest but reaches everywhere; subway is fastest but can mean an additional walk to many locations.

To complete an assignment, reporters first must arrive on the spot by exact roll of either two dice or one of the two. If they fail to land on the space two turns in a row, they have missed the story and must head back to the office. However, if they stroll back, they get a chance to draw an Assignment card on any other Assignment location on which they land, getting partial or full credit for that story instead.

Players who do land on their Assignment locations must then try to draw a News Card that matches their assignments, drawing twice a turn until they do. When they do draw the right match, they normally get one Service Token, but none if sent to Rewrite, and two if labelled Front Page. Then they head back to get another assignment. First player to get five Service Tokens wins.

name: Dragon War: Gateways Set
description:
This set adds 6 gateway cards.

The cards are randomly added to the field to provide 'gateways' forward and backwards.

The cards allow players the ability to 'gate' through the line of cards, unfortunately the 'jump' is made to a random gate.

This expansion can now be obtained as a free download on their site.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Squiggle Connect
description:
Squiggle Connect is a hilarious drawing game where players compete by changing a squiggly line into a picture. No artistic talent required . . . just your imagination!

It all starts with a roll of the dot cube and then the dots are connected by random lines using the connect cube. Once everyone has their unique squiggly line in front of them, play begins. Players have 60 seconds to transform their wavy and wacky line into a picture. They can be as simple or detailed as they want. When time is up, each player explains their drawing to the other players. This is where you may fall over laughing as you listen to some real nonsense! Once each player has had chance to explain what they drew, voting begins. Each player votes on only one other players drawing using a voting card.

The voting cards offer either a descriptive praise or a nuance of criticism such as "put that in a doggie bag" or "a monkey can do better". Each card also has a point value and players give them to each other based on their picture and description. It’s hysterical!

SQUIGGLE Connect recently won a National Parenting Publications Gold Award!

(from manufacturer's website)

name: Rolaweel Three in One
description:
User summary...

Advertised as "Everyone's Game". Basically three different version of spin a spinner and lay down a bland chip on a bland board. In 1926 this was considered Entertaining, Fascinating and Thrilling!

Says so right on the box.

name: Giggles Game of Action
description:
User Summary...

Spin a top and wait to see which giggling child's mouth the balls land in to score points. Laugh with your friends and laugh at yourself - Giggles Game of Action!

name: Monkey Shines
description:
User Summary...

A children's acting game. Pull a cardboard monkey out of the box, read the action silently to yourself and act out as directed. Either award points for the best acting or use the cards to play charades.

name: Nessi!
description: The swimming ring is placed into the water, players receive all discs of one colour. In his turn a player drops one of his discs into the water, it schwims either showing Nessi or the empty side. Then the next player drops a disc, if it hits another disc in the water, this is turned over. When all discs have been dropped, the player with the most Nessis visisble on his discs wins the game. In a variant one can end the game when the first player has 5 Nessis showing.

name: Großer Preis von Deutschland
description:
User Summary:
An old roll and move race game in german language about Nurburgring circuit.
The players throw the dice to determine the starting positions, then advance their tokens according to the subsequent launch of the dice.
On the track there are points that help competitors to move faster, or force them to lose precious time waiting for a favorable launch.
The first player who crosses the finish line after six turns (but at beginning of the game he may also determine a different number) is the winner.

name: I Numeri Incrociati
description:
User summary:
Addition with numbers like Scrabble.
From box:
"I Numeri Incrociati" are for lovers of figures and calculations that are the crossword puzzles for fans of the vocabulary.
The principle is simple: to achieve, adding the chips numbered one or more of the numbers from the cards drawn at random at the beginning of the game.
At the billboard can cross because each successive combinations can be achieved either horizontally or vertically.

name: Campionato Mondiale di Motociclismo
description:
User summary:
Roll and move race game about Moto GP of early '70.
From rules:
At the game can participate from 2 to 5 competitors.
The entire route is divided into 25 fractions by 10 km each. Players will proceed on the track throwing the dice, whose numbers indicate the gear on the vehicle, 6 indicates a stop (not moving).
Before you start you have put along the track the employees to pit which will, to player who stops in the vicinity, the chances of mechanical failure to his bike.
The "Campionato Mondiale di Motociclismo"will be held in several Grands Prix each of which will be ongoing in the 125cc category (will be held at 1 lap), 350cc (to be played in 2 turns) and 500cc (to be played in 3 rounds).

name: Scoutspelet
description:
This is a pretty blatant (and surely unlicensed) ripoff of Trivial Pursuit.

Everything in the game revolves around scouting. The categories are "Lord & Lady Baden-Powell", "International", "Events and places", "Swedish history and now", and "Literature and misc". Players roll dice to move pawns around the board and ask questions related to the category-space upon which they land. The goal of the game is to get point-pieces by landing on the prime space for the category and correctly answering a question in that category. The goal is to get point-pieces in all of the categories and then answer a final quesion from a category chosen by the opponents.

name: Der Mueller
description:
From the back of the box:

Nestled deep in the Black Forest of Bavaria lay the town of Shoental. Although the villagers worked hard, the village remained in poverty, because the domination of the dragon Gruenaugen. Gruenaugen demanded half of all goods produced by the village, or the villagers would face destruction from the dragon's wrath. Many a young lad had set forth to slay the dragon, never to return.

The young town miller (der Mueller) spent many hours thinking about the plight of his town. He knew that previous attempts to destroy the dragon by force had been fruitless. He also knew that Gruenaugen loved games, as all dragons feel they are intellectually superior. He invented a game that only the cleverest would win and confronted the dragon with a deal: freedom of the village if der Mueller won, or enslavement of der Mueller if Gruenaugen won. Gruenaugen, feeling he was superior, naturally accepted.

Der Mueller facest the hardest test of his life but overwhelmed the dragon with his strategy and won. Der Mueller returned to the village a hero. Gruenaugen was never seen again.

A strategy game for two players. The object of the game is to capture 5 of your opponent's gems. Each player starts with 8 gems and tries to complete trios to capture theur opponent's gems by placing their gems on the board during phase one, sliding their gems during phase two, and picking up and moving their gems during phase three.

Re-Implements:

Nine Men's Morris

name: Wallis's New Game of Universal History and Chronology
description:
'Locomotive Game'

This game from 1840 is a reworked issue of the 1814 edition of the game and the central area of the game has been updated to reflect later historical events.

The racing track comprises of 143 circles, starting with Adam & Eve and ending with a railway train.

name: Cosmic Goldrush
description:
Designer comments:
Cosmic Goldrush is a game where players try to mine for gold and platinum on the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter. On the always-moving, always-perilous, always-changing belt you got look after your water supplies, as well as yourself. Get stranded too long on an asteroid and you'll find yourself out of the board, quite a lot of poorer than a turn before.

Mine, trade, buy stuff, bug your friends and visit the infamous Space saloon for more new stuff.

name: Undead Nations
description:
Front Cover Caption:

The Global Expansion to Undead States of America

Publisher Blurb:

While the focus of the core rulebook, Undead States of America, was obviously the United States and North America, the Zombie War is a global one.

This expansion of the basic rules provides new types of terrain for the campaign games, including deserts, swamps, jungles, dense urban populations, and radioactive wastelands.

It also includes detailed maps and rule modifications for other regions on the planet and how to fight the Zombie War raging across the world.

name: Undead Universe
description:
Front Cover Caption:

The Historic Expansion to Undead States of America

Publisher Blurb:

Undead Universe takes a look at the smaller zombie outbreaks throughout time, allowing the players to recreate those earlier battles and playing out the potential undead wars in the past and future.

Undead Universe is intended to be used as an expansion to the core rulebook, Undead States of America. It contains guidelines for zombie wars and outbreaks against ancient armies, medieval armies, the armies of muskets and early rifles, armies in the two World Wars (Nazi Zombies!), and fictional cyberized or powered armor armies of the far future. This book revises how to do the Short Campaign Game in different eras, and introduces a new campaign game where a player fights each major zombie outbreak in history and into the future.

name: Greyhound Racing
description:
A game made in England in the 1950's. There is no publisher listed on the game box. It is a very simple roll and move game on a board with a serpentine track that goes from the start (0) to the finish line (100).
A six is needed to start the race and an exact roll is needed to hit the finish line. There are many penalty spaces on the board that will stop you or move you back. there are some bonus spaces which move you ahead or give you an extra die roll.
It comes in a simple cardboard box with the 5 sentence rules glued to the inside top cover lid. The tri-fold board is ~ 16" x 10" when unfolded. There are 4 different colored plastic greyhounds for pawns. A small plastic die tumbler and die are also included.

name: By Air To Australia
description: Roll & Move about the air journey from Croydon Airport England to Charleville Australia with the normal roll & move hazards (Oil Trouble Miss A Turn, Head Wind Throw a 3 Before Proceeding etc)

name: Poznajemy Kolory
description:
Poznajemy Kolory is a children's game for 2-4 players, Ages 4 - 8.

This game is a child's introduction to colors.

The game is designed to encourage children to compare and logical thinking.

Players in this game have only one task - they have to identified as soon as possible the colors thrown a pair of colorful dice and associate them with the colors of cardboards on the table, spread cocks. Who will recognize the appropriate colors on the rooster, that puts him on his chip. Very simple rules of the game makes it fun for young and older children and even adults. The youngest learn the recognition and naming colors.

name: 3singes
description:
3singes (3monkeys) is a unique party game, as it handicaps the players. It is based on the chinese three monkeys of wisdom.

One player is blind but knows all (with 3 cards) and must tell the mute player how to mime the phrase to the deaf, without saying to the mute what he is miming, but HOW to do it, and the blind cannot see if the mute mime it correctly.

The deaf players (having iPods or similar things) don't hear what the blind is saying, so they must try to understand the blind's message according to the mute's mimes. If a blind player hears a correct element, he indicates the mute a deaf got a good answer and points are scored.

name: Pastora or the Shepherdess of the Pyrenees: A diverting game calculated to kill care and enliven the dreary hours of winter
description:
This Game, like many others of a similar nature, will shew the variety and innocent amusement that may be derived from a Pack of Cards; were the admirers of them as solicitous to acquire the useful lessons with which they are fraught, as they are to appropriate them to the destruction of each other's fortune, they would soon take precedence of every invention for the exercise of the mind.

Pastora or the Shepherdess of the Pyrenees, is represented in the centre of the plate which accompanies the Rules. In the corners representations of playing cards - King of Hearts, Queen of Spades, Jack of Clubs, 10 of Diamonds.

Equipment required: pack of playing cards.

name: Walker's New Geographical Game Exhibiting a Tour Through Europe
description:
In order to play this European centred race game each player must have a marker, four counters and an eight-sided teetotum. There are 133 playing spaces covering the gameboard. The race begins in London and ends in Athens. A separate booklet sets out the rules. As well as providing information on the history and commerce of the places, the game also encouraged reading and conversational skills.

Published May 1st, 1810.

name: An historical game of England: The royal generalogical pastime of the sovereigns of England from Egbert to George 3rd
description:
The game is in the form of a family tree with each monarch named in numbered circles. Those circles before William l are in pink and those after are yellow. Circle one is the DIVISIONS OF THE HISTORY OF ENGLAND, and it leads to Britons, Romans, Saxons and Saxon Heptarchy then Saxon kings, Danish kings, restored Saxon kings, and the various houses from the Normans to the Brunswick.

Published March 10th 1804.

name: Waterhole
description:
Waterhole is a co-operative game whereby the aim of the game is to get the herbivores into the waterhole and back to their home territories without any of them being eaten by the carnivores. This game was originally designed to accompany the teaching pack 'Conflict, Change and Our Future'. It was intended for use in schools for children aged between 9 and 13.

Published in Norwich, UK.

name: The Mount of Knowledge
description:
The game features a path through a landscape, with small circular pictures showing a wood, a river and other features. The first circle, called the Horn Book, reflects one of the teaching methods of the time. Players must stop here to learn the letters of the alphabet. There are various forfeits and rewards along the way. These include punishments for boasting, wasting time and pride, and rewards for repentance, patience and diligence.

You are to be provided with a Teetotum having 8 sides, marked 1 to 8, and each player with a traveller (marker) and 8 counters of which 4 are to be put into the Pool. The highest spinner begins and to proceed regularly to the right hand.
publishers: J. Harris, John Wallis, W. Richardson

name: The royal game of the gathering of nations: Exhibition of the industry of all nations
description:
Spiral race game with coloured lithographs illustrating various places and industries. It terminates in the centre with a view of the Great Exhibition building.

Published in London.

name: A New Royal Geographical Pastime for England and Wales
description:
At the gameboard there are 169 principal and county towns joined by lines. The descriptions and rules on either side of the map list each town and any rewards or forfeits to be made. There are no charges for moving from one place to another. One of the better rewards occurs at Stonehenge 'worthy of visiting without expense, from whence you are to be removed to Chester at 148'. One of the harshest is at Knaresborough, 163, 'which has four medicinal springs of different qualities; to drink from them you must pay 1 counter and are conveyed to Bath, 2'.

The game itself is enlightening, for it not only refers to visiting stately homes, cathedrals, churches and other public buildings but also describes events, folklore, and geographical features such as smuggling, the flitch of bacon given at Dunmow and the Giant's Causeway.

Published June 1st, 1787.

Equipment required: teetotum, ivory pillars (markers), counters

name: Columbia or the Land of the West
description:
The game begins with the discovery of America by Christopher Columbus in 1492, and ends with the Treaty of Independence of 1782. It can be played either historically or topographically.

There are 36 dated entries in the rules booklet that describe the history of North America and the United States from 1492 to 1782. There is also a list of 38 states and capitals, including six that are Canadian, still British possessions at the time of the game.
publishers: (Unknown), E. & M. A. Ogilvy, R. H. Laurie

name: The Fancy Bazaar or Aristocratic Traders
description:
Mainly a card game, with the gameboard being a place to put the counters.

The aim of the Bazaar is fourfold: to aid the Acclimatisation of Society, to help pay the National Debt, to raise a fund to build a bridge from Dover to Calais, and to build a school to teach Grown Children.

The stalls are run as follows: the Fruiterer and Greengrocer is Lady Verysoft, the Grocer is Mrs Plausible, the Pastrycook is Miss Wheedleton, the Toy Dealer is Baroness Goodchild, the Earthenware Dealer is the Duchess of Otherland, the Hosier and Glover is Viscountess Pumicestone, the Poulterer is Miss Silverstone, and the Florist is the Marchioness of Bailbury.

Most of the cards relate to the goods found on these stalls. The players take the part of the various stall holders. The cards are dealt out to the players in turn, who have to follow the instructions of paying counters to the various stalls.

name: Outward bound or ships and their cargoes
description:
The gameboard showing 5 compartments each illustrating a sailing ship. 5 large cards also showing the same ships. 35 small cards representing the captain, pilot and cargo of each ship.

When a player has played all his cards, he is out of the game and may lay his ship and cards aside. If it should happen that only two players remain at the last, the winning player sweeps the board, that is takes all the counters in the five compartments.

name: British Sovereigns or The Circle of English History
description:
A puzzle of 37 non interlocking pieces, hand cut, hand coloured lithograph with back covered with cream paper and 88 cards from a set of 90.

The pieces form a gameboard showing kings and queens in two concentric circles of 36 numbered areas. In each corner is a design of roses, thistles and shamrocks. In the centre is a disc giving the title and maker's details on a pink ground. The cards give details of each monarch from William I to Queen Victoria.

Published in London.

name: Giuoco dei personaggi
description:
Game characters

A race game with an oval track of 56 numbered squares, each with a named illustration and a central illustration showing a pair of men battling in front of a building. Three corners are filled with a triangle showing a floral pattern; the fourth, lower left, shows a building.

Published in Venice, Italy.

name: Special Forces: Modern Military Boardgame
description:
Special Forces, the world of the guerrilla warfare operative, allowing you to take control of a team of these highly trained operators as they under take missions behind enemy lines.

Players have the option to use a team of operators from a well known and respected regiment or customise their own team. The board comprises of a base section onto which building tiles are placed based on the layouts found in the ‘Missions and Scenarios’ book. After that it is up to the player to decide the best way to complete their objectives. All players take control of the special forces operatives or operators working together to complete the aims of the mission at hand.

name: Verbal Volley Middle School Expansion Pack
description:
An expansion to Verbal Volley, with 172 conceptual vocabulary words.

Players ply for eachother of within teams. Players come up with synonyms or antonyms. It's a race against the clock.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: ULTIMATE COMBO: Boxing
description:
It's a card game that simulates a boxing match. Both players draw cards from a single pile. Every card represents an specific action (jab, hook to the body, duck, clinch, etc) that can be linked to another action (jab-cross-left hook...) or countered by specific actions. The round lenght is commanded by the number of cards left in the pile. The match ends when one of the boxer's stamina reach zero (you lose one stamina point for every punch you get), or by instant KO (one KO punch) or TKO (three knockdowns in a single round).
There are 8 diferent types of punch, 4 dodge moves + 2 cancel moves making a total of 14!!! possible actions per boxer. AND aditionally you can play it with a board adding even more moves and strategy.

name: Chariot Arena
description:
Chariot Arena is a Grim Trojan board game based on the chariot races of Roman times and the first of Grim Trojan’s Downloadable Board Games.

To keep the game fun for different levels and ages of players, optional rules have been created (the alternate rules follow the official rules).

This board game is very loosely based on historical records about chariot races. With that said, never forget the game is a board game and as such has been modified to keep game play fun. The arena is based (again, loosely) on Rome’s largest and oldest circus, Circus Maximus (called a circus because of the oval shape).

Attacks are allowed to simulate the whipping and bumping that occurred in a chariot race and the curves are more dangerous in the board game because they were in the real races.

Chariot Arena has two different playing boards to allow for better game play. The larger board comprised of four pages
with smaller hexes was designed for a larger group of players and for those who enjoy longer more detailed game play. The
smaller board comprised of two pages with larger hexes is designed to allow a smaller number of players to have more
interaction in few laps and its charts are less complicated. Try both and play the one that best suits your style of play.

As each player takes their turn, they must first move their pawn 6 hexes. They then have the option to stay where they are or roll 2d6 (two six sided dice) and moving their pawn across the board one hex at a time the number of hexes shown on the dice. Movement can be forward left, forward right or forward. Moving a pawn backward on the track is not permitted. Only one
pawn can occupy a hex at a time. If a pawn is in your way, you must move around it. The player also has the option to move
the pawn less hexes than indicated on the dice (example: a player rolling 10 can move only 7 hexes if they wish). If a pawn’s path is blocked by other pawns and it is impossible to move forward while moving the base 6 hexes, the player must choose which pawn to stop behind. The player and the owner of the other pawn must both roll from the Accident Chart.

name: Chaos Crossing
description:
Description from game pdf

Chaos Crossing is a game for 2 to 4 players. This game requires Pegable Pawns: 4 blue, 4 red, 4 orange, 4 yellow, 1 green, 1 grey, 1 white, 1 brown, 1 purple; 1 game board; 1 six sided die.

The object of the game is to send all of your pawns out onto the board to collect crowns and be the first to return all of your pawns, crowned, to the starting sphere.

name: British Sovereigns
description:
This boardgame includes 56 pictures of British kings and queens from Egbert (died 839), the first English king, to Victoria (1819–1901).

The players are provided with a Card, containing nine Letters, nine Numbers, two Crosses and one Blank, which are to be cut up on the lines with a pair of scissors.

Each player, on drawing a number, is to place his letter on the same number in the Game. When it is his turn to draw another, he adds them together and advances his letter to that number which they make when so added, reading as before, and observing any directions which may be given him. But if he draw a cross, he is to draw again, till he obtain a number, which number is to be deducted from, instead of added to his former station, and his letter moved back accordingly. Each card to be returned to the bag after drawing. Whoever draws a blank, remains at his former number. After each player has drawn once, the boardgame is to be continued in the same manner, passing the bag round, till someone makes up the exact number 151, who wins the Game.

name: Amusement in English History
description:
At this gameboard portraits of 40 British kings and queens, in 80 playing spaces altogether, are shown with events from each of their reigns.

Rules:
The Card sold with the Game is to be divided. The Letters are to mark the players' position on the Game; the Numbers and Blanks are to be placed in a lady's reticule or bag. Draw for the first player; the highest number to begin. Each player on drawing a number is to place his letter on the same number on the Game, unless otherwise ordered in the directors, which must be read aloud. When it is his turn to draw again, he must add his number to the one where his letter stands, and remove it accordingly. If he draws a blank, he must remain where he is. Each card is to be returned to the bag. The game is to proceed in this manner till some player arrives at the Marriage of Queen Victoria, who wins the game. When a player is sent back, he is not to read the Directions, but wait his turn to draw again. The history of each reign may be read or omitted at the time of playing, as the players think fit.

name: The Cottage of Content or the Blessings of Cheerfulness & Good Temper
description:
A card game and a moral game and described on the front of the box as follows: "Showing how Good Dr Lovejoy did invite a party and award his nice Cottage of Content to Master Peter Placid and Miss Felicia Amiable and how it was their happy lot to be the means of converting their friends from their errors".

The game is to continue until all are placed upon the table. Then Dr. Lovejoy will give the Cottage of Content to Peter Placid and Felicia Amiable as a reward for their excellent behaviour, which had promoted so much mirth and good feeling amonst his party of visitors.

name: The Travellers of Europe, with Improvements and Additions
description: Five players take the parts of The Travellers, who are from Austria, Sweden, Russia, Prussia and England. They must make their way to their respective capital cities each starting from a different city in Africa, or on the shore of the Mediterranean Sea. They play with a teetotum or spinner with four sides marked N,S,E,W representing the directions they must move in.

name: The Pirate and Traders of the West Indies
description:
The gameboard consists of 8 sections mounted on linen and showing a map of the Caribbean. The title is at the top and the publisher's details at the lower left. It shows a map of the Caribbean islands together with shipping and latitude and longitude lines.

THE TRADERS are supposed to be trading between the West India Islands and other countries, and are about to start on their voyage from certain places on the coast of Mexico and in the Caribbean sea. These places are indicated by the four letters A,B,C,D, and each trader has a mark corresponding with one of these letters.

The PIRATE, who is to attack or capture the traders on their voyage, has his retreat marked on the coast near to New Orleans, and from this spot he starts at the beginning of the game.

name: Quadrant Z
description:
OBJECTIVE

The objective of the game is to conquer the galaxy - either by occupying the most stars; or by capturing the opponent's home base star, or by destroying the opponent's forces.

SET UP

Each player should draw a 10 by 10 grid. Each set of adjacent 4 squares is grouped into a quadrant, and labeled from A to Y, starting from the top, left hand side quadrant. Each square in a quadrant is numbered from 1 to 4, starting from the top, left hand side square.

One player is allocated the 6 quadrant in the top-left hand side of the board as his home sector, and the other takes the 6 quadrant in the bottom-right hand side of the board as his. The remaining 13 quadrants form the neutral sector. The corner quadrants in each player's home sector are their respective home quadrants.

Each player receives 45 points to create stars in the galaxy.

Quadrat Z is very much a game of cat-and-mouse. As in many wars, you have some idea of an opponent's strength and general location, but very little about the exact composition and location of his forces. Hence, the value of intelligence gathering should not be underrated.

Strategy will vary from game to game, but a major focus should be on the capture of stars: without them your forces will not grow, and , in the long run their lack will certainly cause you to lose. Think carefully about the initial layout of stars, and place your ships to capture the maximum number of points as soon as possible. Try and maintain a balanced force of ship sizes. Movement is hidden, and fairly rapid shifts of forces from one quadrant to another are possible. Remember that in combat the aim is to have the largest combined force - not necessarily a single, high value ship. A single, large strike ship may penetrate enemy lines and take out the opponent's home base... but if he sees it coming he may have time to regroup and knock it out. Spreading your ships out too thinly in a quadrant could also be problematic in combat.

name: The Chronological Star of the World: An Entertaining Game
description:
The gameboard showing a circle with a star pattern of 8 large points alternating with 8 small points, with crescent and star shapes. With a ribbon pattern around outer edge. No. of squares: 109, all illustrated and numbered.

The game is played anti-clockwise with No. 1 at the bottom of the point which is in the central position at the bottom of the game. The first 24 are alternately the points and the ribbon illustrations around the outer edge. Nos. 25 to 56 combine the second illustration in the large points, the first illustration in the small points and the illustrations in the stars and crescents. These two designs are in the spaces between the points and form an alternating pattern of two crescents, two stars. The rest of the numbers are shown on the points and around the central illustration which is dedicated to the Abolition of Slavery.

name: The Infant's Cabinet of Fishes
description: Wooden box with sliding lid that has an illustration of a fishbowl containing three fish on a table in a garden. The box contains cards and a small booklet. The booklet is titled A History of Fishes Volume II and has descriptions of 30 fish. The fish cards each have a hand coloured etching of a fish with its name and a reference to where it appears in the History of Fishes. Also on the card is the publisher's name and address and date of publication, October 3rd 1801.

name: Armored Trooper Votoms: The Battling Card Game
description:
Armored Trooper Votoms: The Battling Card Game (
装甲騎兵ボトムズ ザ バトリング カードゲーム) is a collectible card game inspired by events in the anime of the same name.

Game-play focuses on the competitors in the Astradan empire's premier bloodsport: Armored Trooper (AT) Battling.

Be the first to exhaust your opponent's deck in an effort to destroy their AT and take your place among Uoodo's finest.

name: Die kleinen Abenteurer
description:
The board game shows a map of the eastern half of the world: Europe, Asia, Africa and Australia with part of Alaska.

The game is played by following the pattern of circles numbered 2 to 50. Circles 9,11,16,19,24,40 and 45 are red and represent rewards; circles 2,3,8,13,17,18,22,29,36,37,41,42,46 and 49 are white and represent forfeits. The rest of the circles are blue. You start at Berlin.

Published in Germany.

name: Flippin' Dolphins
description:
Flip your hoops onto dolphins to win! Be the first player to score 50 points.

An electronic base unit containing 4 colored dolphin heads is turned on and rotates around while dolphin heads bob up and down. Each player places one of his 10 rings on his seal's tail and flips the tailback to release the ring. Players keep flipping rings until all 10 have been used. This constitutes a round. AT the end of a round scores are tallied :
A ring around a large spinning dolphin of your color: 5 points
A ring around and large color spinning dolphin: 3 points
A ring around any stationary gray dolphin: 1 point

Players keep playing round until a someone reaches a total score of 50 points.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic

name: Mister Master
description:
This is a football simulation performed with the cards.
It's possible to simulate any football game, a player against the other or in teams.
Players move with the launch of one or two dice on a default path, trying to end their movement on the boxes that allow him to play cards to attack.
If your opponent has cards appropriate defense, interrupts the action of attack and can leave again becoming he attacker, otherwise the first player to draw cards that will enable him to perform actions prior to center field, then in the area up to the shot.
A goal is scored when launching the special dice, you get the symbol on.
The game ends when the entire path will be traced.
Obviously wins whoever marked the most goals.
It is possible to conclude the match in a draw.

name: Wrap Cut Bang
description:
The object of the game is to place all of your pieces onto the playing surface before your opponent can place all of theirs.

Each player receives 18 pieces in their colour. The pieces either show a 'rock', 'scissors', or 'paper' symbol. Each turn you must play your "reserve" tile that you selected the previous turn, and then select a new tile for your reserve, anticipating your opponent's next move. Placements rules are basically that your symbol must overpower at least one other symbol beside it (using standard rock-scissors-paper rules.) You lose a turn if you can't place your reserve piece onto the board, and you must then choose a new reserve piece for your next turn.

name: Medieval Times Game
description:
From the box: "New Family Game. Official Game of Medieval Times Dinner & Tournament. The Epic Game of Tournament Competition."

From the inner box: "My noble knights, you honor me with your presence. I Don Raimundo II, Count of Perelada, welcome you to my castle for a tournament of games. Now let the tournament begin!"

From the rules: "Be the first player to obtain all four tournament Victory Cards and present them to the Count and Countess at the Victory Banquet. The four tournaments are as follows: Sword Fighting, Ring Piercing, Jousting, Javelin throwing."

User summary: The game consists of a rolled-up cloth-backed faux-leather board with all four events located around the castle along with--in each corner--the sequence of moves to participate in each event; Fate cards, Victory cards in four colors: Salmon, Blue, Yellow and Green. 4 pewter knights in each of those colors; one die and the rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
